title: Ronaldo (film)
text: It follows the life and career of Portuguese professional footballer Cristiano Ronaldo.

title: Ronaldo (film)
text: The film was released worldwide on 9 November 2015.

title: Ronaldo (film)
text: A trailer for the film was released on 28 September 2015.

title: Invasion of the Neptune Men
text: The film was released in 1961 in Japan and was later released in the United States on television.

title: Invasion of the Neptune Men
text: In 1998, the film was featured on an episode of" Mystery Science Theater 3000".

title: A Race for Life
text: A Race for Life is a 1928 American silent drama film directed by D. Ross Lederman.

title: A Race for Life
text: Originally, the film was presumed to be lost.

title: A Race for Life
text: However, according to the Library of Congress Database, the film was found in the Netherlands.

title: A Race for Life
text: The film was released with a Vitaphone soundtrack with a synchronised musical score and sound effects.

title: Lo Zappatore
text: Lo Zappatore is a 1950 Italian film directed by Rate Furlan.

title: Battle in Outer Space
text: The film was released theatrically in the United States in the summer of 1960 by Columbia Pictures.

title: Gwenc'hlan
text: Gwenc'hlan is the cognomen of a legendary 6th century Breton druid and bard called Kian, the subject and purported author of a Breton song called" Diougan Gwenc'hlan"( Gwenc'hlan's prophecy), published by Hersart de la Villemarqué in his 1839 anthology" Barzaz Breiz".

title: Gwenc'hlan
text: In this song, Gwenc'hlan is imprisoned after having his eyes gouged out for refusing to convert to Christianity, sings out that he is n't afraid to die and makes a prophecy wherein he will be avenged.

title: Gwenc'hlan
text: The motive of the blinded prisoner is reminiscent of the historical fate of Boethius.

title: Gwenc'hlan
text: One Gwenc'hlan or Guinclaff around 1450 wrote a" chant royal", or" Dialogue between King Arthur and Gwenc'hlan", quoted by Dom Le Pelletier and Gregory of Rostrenen.

title: Gwenc'hlan
text: The poem was rediscovered in 1924.

title: Gwenc'hlan
text: The Breton used by this Gwenc'hlan is already deeply pervaded by French.

title: Gwenc'hlan
text: The legend of the 6th century bard is largely a creation of de la Villemarqué's, but he may have based his account on the 15th century author, as well as on other traditional Breton tales.

title: Gwenc'hlan
text: He quotes 6th to 12th century Welsh poems attributed to the bards Aneurin, Taliesin and Llywarch Hen as his sources.

title: Wesley Barresi
text: Wesley Barresi( born 3 May 1984) is a South African born first- class and Netherlands international cricketer.

title: Wesley Barresi
text: He is a right- handed wicket keeper- batsman and also bowls right- arm offbreak.

title: Gwenc'hlan Le Scouëzec
text: Loïc Gwenc'hlan Le Scouëzec( 11 November 1929, Plouescat, Finistère – 6 February 2008) was a Breton writer and Grand Druid of Brittany.

title: Per Vari Kerloc'h
text: Per Vari Kerloc'h( born 1952) is the current Grand Druid of the" Goursez Breizh"( founded in 1899).

title: Per Vari Kerloc'h
text: He was born at Douarnenez, in the western part of Brittany.

title: Per Vari Kerloc'h
text: The Grand Druid is appointed for life( Kerloc'h succeeded his predecessor Gwenc'hlan Le Scouëzec), whereas the Welsh and Cornish equivalents are now elected every three years.

title: Per Vari Kerloc'h
text: Kerloc'h has been a middle manager and trade union representative with La Poste.

title: Per Vari Kerloc'h
text: He is a native Breton speaker and a fluent speaker of Cornish.

title: Per Vari Kerloc'h
text: His bardic name is" Morgan".

title: Per Vari Kerloc'h
text: Per Vari Kerloc'h was welcomed at the Welsh National Eisteddfod in Cardiff(" Kerdiz" in Breton) in 2008.

title: Per Vari Kerloc'h
text: An article in English published in the newspaper" Connexion" explains that after 2 years as a disciple, it is possible to become an Ovate, Bard or Druid, as in Wales.

title: Per Vari Kerloc'h
text: This is different from Gorseth Kernow which has one order, Bards, and a Grand Bard who is elected for just one 3- year period.

title: Per Vari Kerloc'h
text: " Goursez Breizh" has members who are Christian, Jewish or atheist; on the principle that anyone living in Brittany is Breton.

title: Per Vari Kerloc'h
text: However there are hopes that a younger new leader, rooted in Breton language culture will refocus the" Goursez" on Breton cultural matters as was the original intent of the movement.

title: John McMahon (Surrey and Somerset cricketer)
text: John William Joseph McMahon( 28 December 1917 – 8 May 2001) was an Australian- born first- class cricketer who played for Surrey and Somerset in England from 1947 to 1957.

title: Maurice Le Scouëzec
text: Maurice Le Scouëzec, was born in Mans on 1 October 1881 and died at Douarnenez on the 1 May 1940.

title: Maurice Le Scouëzec
text: He was a French artist, engraver, illustrator and writer.

title: Şemsettin Baş
text: Şemsettin Baş( born January 4, 1973 in Istanbul, Turkey) is a retired Turkish professional basketball player.

title: Şemsettin Baş
text: At 6 ft 5.75 in( 1.97 m), he played as a shooting guard and small forward.

title: Hartley Lobban
text: Hartley W Lobban (9 May 1926 – 15 October 2004) was a Jamaican-born first-class cricketer who played 17 matches for Worcestershire in the early 1950s.

title: Wale Adebanwi
text: Wale Adebanwi( born 1969) is a Nigerian- born first Black Rhodes Professor at St Antony's College, Oxford.

title: Henry Moore (cricketer)
text: Henry Walter Moore( 1849 – 20 August 1916) was an English- born first- class cricketer who spent most of his life in New Zealand.

title: Jacques Décombe
text: Jacques Décombe is a French author, actor and director born in 1953.

title: The Majesty of the Law
text: The Majesty of the Law is a 1915 American drama silent film written and directed by Julia Crawford Ivers.

title: The Majesty of the Law
text: The film stars George Fawcett( in his film debut), Jane Wolfe, William Desmond, Myrtle Stedman, John Oaker and Charlie Ruggles.

title: The Majesty of the Law
text: The film was released on August 26, 1915, by Paramount Pictures.

title: Julia Crawford Ivers
text: Julia Crawford Ivers( October 3, 1869 – May 8, 1930) was an American motion picture pioneer.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: T. V. Chandran( born 23 November 1950) is an Indian film director, screenwriter, and actor, predominantly working in Malayalam cinema.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: Born in a Malayali family in Telicherry, Chandran worked as a Reserve Bank of India employee before entering into the film industry.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: He started his film career as an assistant director to P. A. Backer.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: He also acted the lead role in Backer's highly acclaimed political drama" Kabani Nadi Chuvannappol"( 1975).

title: T. V. Chandran
text: He made his directorial debut with the unreleased feature" Krishnan Kutty"( 1981), and followed this with the Tamil film" Hemavin Kadhalargal"( 1985).

title: T. V. Chandran
text: Chandran came into prominence after" Alicinte Anveshanam"( 1989), which was nominated for the Golden Leopard at the Locarno International Film Festival.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: This was followed with" Ponthan Mada"( 1993), his most famous film to- date.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: Chandran is most known for his art- house films which have references to history and undertones of politics and feminism.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: He is also known for his trilogy on 2002 Gujarat riots, consisting of" Kathavasheshan"( 2004)," Vilapangalkappuram"( 2008) and" Bhoomiyude Avakashikal"( 2012).

title: T. V. Chandran
text: Other highly acclaimed films include" Mangamma"( 1997)," Dany"( 2001) and( 2003).

title: T. V. Chandran
text: Chandran is widely regarded as one of the finest directors in Indian cinema and is widely credited with having revolutionised parallel cinema with his complex- structured art- house films.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: Chandran has won several film awards including six National Film Awards and ten Kerala State Film Awards.

title: T. V. Chandran
text: In addition to these, he is a recipient of a number of awards at various International film festivals.

title: Sepideh Farsi
text: Sepideh Farsi is an Iranian film director, born in Tehran in 1965.

title: W. Augustus Barratt
text: W. Augustus Barratt( 1873- 1947) was a Scottish- born, later American, songwriter and musician.

title: Bhoomiyude Avakashikal
text: Bhoomiyude Avakashikal

title: Bhoomiyude Avakashikal
text: ( English:" The Inheritors of the Earth") is a 2012 Malayalam feature film written and directed by T. V. Chandran.

title: Bhoomiyude Avakashikal
text: The film stars Kailash in the lead role along with Sreenivasan and Mythili who play pivotal supporting roles.

title: Bhoomiyude Avakashikal
text: The film was produced by Anand Kumar under the banner of Yes Cinema and it was mainly shot in Nelliyampathi, Ottappalam and Shoranur in Kerala.

title: Bhoomiyude Avakashikal
text: " Bhoomiyude Avakashikal" is the third and last installment of T. V. Chandran's trilogy on 2002 Gujarat riots.

title: Bhoomiyude Avakashikal
text: The first one was," Kathavasheshan"( 2004), it was followed by" Vilapangalkkappuram"( 2008).

title: Bhoomiyude Avakashikal
text: The narratives of all these films begin on the same day, 28 February 2002, that is, on the day after the Godhra train burning in Gujarat.

title: Bhoomiyude Avakashikal
text: " Bhoomiyude Avakashikal" tells the story of Mohanachandran Nair, who is driven away from Ahmadabad following the Gujarat riots and who eventually loses his job and even his identity and ultimately lands up in a secluded house in Kerala, in the company of insects and animals with whom he shares his thoughts, concerns, doubts and frustrations.

title: Bhoomiyude Avakashikal
text: The film was shot digitally to reduce costs as it was required to film several insects and animals in their natural habitat.

title: Bhoomiyude Avakashikal
text: The film premiered at the 43rd International Film Festival of India on 27 November 2012.

title: Bhoomiyude Avakashikal
text: It was also an official selection for the International Film Festival of Kerala.

title: Tchan Fou-li
text: Tchan Fou-li( June 21, 1916 – September 11, 2018) was a Hong Kong photographer who worked to develop distinctive Chinese forms of photography and to establish photography as a serious art form in Hong Kong.

title: Tchan Fou-li
text: He is known for his photographs, described as evoking the artistic values and composition of Chinese landscape paintings.

title: Tchan Fou-li
text: A" New York Times" reviewer called him" one of the great visual artists of his time" because of his" carefully crafted images that celebrate the beauty of the human condition and the majesty of nature."

title: Claude Weisz
text: Claude Weisz is a French film director born in Paris.

title: Fred Roy Krug
text: Fred R. Krug is an American film and television producer- director born in Bern, Switzerland.

title: Greg Penner
text: Gregory B. Penner( born December 18, 1969) is an American businessman and venture capitalist.

title: Greg Penner
text: Penner was named the chairman of Walmart on June 5, 2015.

title: Greg Penner
text: He is the son-in- law of S. Robson Walton and the grandson- in- law of Sam Walton, the founder of Walmart.

title: Julia (daughter of Caesar)
text: Julia (c. 76 BC – 54 BC) was the daughter of Roman dictator Julius Caesar by his first or second wife Cornelia, and his only child from his marriages.

title: Julia (daughter of Caesar)
text: Julia became the fourth wife of Pompey the Great and was renowned for her beauty and virtue.

title: Conny Stuart
text: Conny Stuart( 5 September 1913 – 22 August 2010), pseudonym of Cornelia van Meijgaard, was a Dutch actress, singer, and" cabaretière".

title: Peter James (writer)
text: Peter J James( born 22 August 1948) is an international British writer of crime fiction.

title: Peter James (writer)
text: He was born in Brighton, the son of Cornelia James, the former glovemaker to Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Eusebius (consul 359)
text: Flavius Eusebius( died after AD 371) was a Roman Senator, who was the brother- in- law of the emperor Constantius II.

title: Charles Francis Norton
text: Charles Francis Norton( 1807 – 1835) was a 19th- century Member of Parliament for Guildford.

title: Charles Francis Norton
text: Norton was also a Captain of 52nd Light Infantry; son-in- law of Sir Colin Campbell; brother- in- law of writer Caroline Norton

title: Cornelia (wife of Caesar)
text: Cornelia (c. 97 – c. 69 BC) was the first or second wife of Caesar, and the mother of his only daughter, Julia.

title: Cornelia (wife of Caesar)
text: A daughter of Lucius Cornelius Cinna, Cornelia was related by birth or marriage to many of the most influential figures of the late Republic.

title: Wyndham Goold
text: Wyndham Goold( 1812-1854) was a Member of Parliament( MP) for County Limerick from 1850 to 1854.

title: Wyndham Goold
text: Goold was educated at Westminster School and Trinity College, Dublin.

title: Wyndham Goold
text: He was the son in law of Frederick Falkiner Goold, Archdeacon of Raphoe and brother in law of Bishop Hamilton Verschoyle

title: Robert Vadra
text: Robert Vadra is an Indian businessman, entrepreneur and the husband of Priyanka Gandhi.

title: Robert Vadra
text: He is the son -in- law of Sonia Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi, and the brother- in- law of Rahul Gandhi.

title: Robert W. Levering
text: Robert Woodrow Levering( October 3, 1914 – August 11, 1989) was a U.S. Representative from Ohio, son-in- law of Usher L. Burdick and brother- in- law of Quentin N. Burdick.

title: John Middleton Murry Jr.
text: John Middleton Murry Jr. (9 May 1926 – 31 March 2002) was an English writer who used the names Colin Murry and Richard Cowper.

title: John Middleton Murry
text: John Middleton Murry (6 August 1889 – 12 March 1957) was an English writer.

title: John Middleton Murry
text: He was a prolific author, producing more than 60 books and thousands of essays and reviews on literature, social issues, politics, and religion during his lifetime.

title: John Middleton Murry
text: A prominent critic, Murry is best remembered for his association with Katherine Mansfield, whom he married in 1918 as her second husband, for his friendship with D. H. Lawrence and T. S. Eliot, and for his friendship (and brief affair) with Frieda Lawrence.

title: John Middleton Murry
text: Following Mansfield's death, Murry edited her work.

title: John Middleton (footballer, born 1955)
text: John Middleton( born 11 July 1955) is an English former footballer who played for Bradford City and Macclesfield Town.

title: John Middleton (footballer, born 1955)
text: He was born in Rawmarsh, near Rotherham.

title: Anne Estelle Rice
text: Anne Estelle Rice( 1877 – 1959) was an American sculptor and artist who was one of the chief illustrators for the British periodical" Rhythm", edited by John Middleton Murry and Michael Sadleir from 1911 to 1913.

title: Anne Estelle Rice
text: She established a close relationship with Katherine Mansfield, and famously painted her wearing red.

title: Philip Mairet
text: Philip Mairet( full name: Philippe Auguste Mairet; 1886–1975) was a designer, writer and journalist.

title: Philip Mairet
text: He had a wide range of interest: crafts, Alfred Adler and psychiatry, and Social Credit.

title: Philip Mairet
text: He translated major figures including Jean- Paul Sartre.

title: Philip Mairet
text: He wrote biographies of Sir Patrick Geddes and A. R. Orage, with both of whom he was closely associated, as well as of John Middleton Murry.

title: Philip Mairet
text: As editor of the" New English Weekly" in the 1930s, he championed both Christian socialism, as it was known at the time, and ideas on agriculture that would come together later as organic farming.

title: J. W. N. Sullivan
text: John William Navin Sullivan( 1886–1937) was a popular science writer and literary journalist, and the author of a study of Beethoven.

title: J. W. N. Sullivan
text: He wrote some of the earliest non-technical accounts of Einstein ’s General Theory of Relativity, and was known personally to many important writers in London in the 1920s, including Aldous Huxley, John Middleton Murry, Wyndham Lewis, Aleister Crowley and T. S. Eliot.

title: Lamman Rucker
text: Lamman Rucker( born October 6, 1971) is an American actor.

title: Lamman Rucker
text: Rucker began his career on the daytime soap operas" As the World Turns" and" All My Children", before roles in Tyler Perry's films

title: Lamman Rucker
text: " Why Did I Get Married?

title: Lamman Rucker
text: Why Did I Get Married Too?", and" Meet the Browns", and its television adaptation.

title: Lamman Rucker
text: In 2016, he began starring as Jacob Greenleaf in the Oprah Winfrey Network drama series," Greenleaf".

title: John Middleton (architect)
text: John Middleton( 1820–1885) was an English architect of the 19th century.

title: John Middleton (architect)
text: He was born in York, in August 1820.

title: Richard T. Jones
text: Richard Timothy Jones( born January 16, 1972) is an American actor.

title: Richard T. Jones
text: Jones is best known for his portrayals of Laveinio in the dramatic film" The Wood"( 1999) and Mike of the dramatic films" Why Did I Get Married?"( 2007) and" Why Did I Get Married Too?"( 2010).

title: Richard T. Jones
text: He is also well known for his role as Bruce Van Exel, court services officer on the CBS television series" Judging Amy" that aired from 1999 to 2005.

title: Katherine Mansfield
text: Kathleen Mansfield Murry ("née" Beauchamp; 14 October 1888 – 9 January 1923) was a prominent New Zealand modernist short story writer and poet who was born and brought up in colonial New Zealand and wrote under the pen name of Katherine Mansfield.

title: Katherine Mansfield
text: At the age of 19, she left New Zealand and settled in England, where she became a friend of writers such as D. H. Lawrence and Virginia Woolf.

title: Katherine Mansfield
text: Mansfield was diagnosed with extrapulmonary tuberculosis in 1917; the disease claimed her life at the age of 34.

title: Sama' al-Dawla
text: Sama' al- Dawla was the Buyid ruler of Hamadan( 1021- 1023 or 1024).

title: Sama' al-Dawla
text: He was the son of Shams al- Dawla.

title: Sama' al-Dawla
text: Upon his father's death, Sama' al- Dawla succeeded him to the governorship of that province.

title: Sama' al-Dawla
text: Only after a short reign, however, the Kakuyid ruler Muhammad ibn Rustam Dushmanziyar overran Hamadan and ended Sama' al- Dawla's rule.

title: Eskandar II
text: Eskandar II, was the ruler of the Paduspanid dynasty from 1333 to 1359.

title: Eskandar II
text: He was the son and successor of Taj al- Dawla Ziyar.

title: Ka'us III
text: Ka'us III, was the fourth ruler of the Paduspanid branch of Kojur.

title: Ka'us III
text: He was the son and successor of Ashraf ibn Taj al- Dawla.

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: Asfar ibn Kurduya( also spelled Kurdawayh, Kardawayh and Kurdawaih), was a Daylamite officer who served the Buyid dynasty.

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: Asfar is first mentioned during the reign of the Buyid ruler Adud al- Dawla, as one of the most prominent officers of the Empire.

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: After the death of Adud al- Dawla in 983, the Buyid Empire was thrown into civil war; the Empire was disputed between his two sons Samsam al- Dawla and Sharaf al- Dawla.

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: Samsam al- Dawla ruled Iraq, while Sharaf al- Dawla ruled Fars and Kerman.

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: In 986, Asfar rebelled against Samsam al- Dawla, and changed his allegiance to Sharaf al- Dawla.

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: However, Asfar quickly changed his mind, and declared allegiance to the latter's other brother Abu Nasr Firuz Kharshadh, who was shortly given the" laqab" of" Baha' al- Dawla."

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: However, Samsam al- Dawla, with the aid of Fuladh ibn Manadhar, suppressed the rebellion, and imprisoned Baha al- Dawla.

title: Asfar ibn Kurduya
text: After this event, Asfar is no longer mentioned.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: Fannā (Panāh) Khusraw , better known by his laqab of ʿAḍud al-Dawla ("Pillar of the  Dynasty")

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: (September 24, 936 – March 26, 983) was an emir of the Buyid dynasty, ruling from 949 to 983, and at his height of power ruling an empire stretching from Makran as far to Yemen and the shores of the Mediterranean Sea.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: He is widely regarded as the greatest monarch of the dynasty, and by the end of his reign was the most powerful ruler in the Middle East.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: The son of Rukn al-Dawla, Fanna Khusraw was given the title of Adud al-Dawla by the Abbasid caliph in 948 when he was made emir of Fars after the death of his childless uncle

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: Imad al-Dawla, after which Rukn al-Dawla became the senior emir of the Buyids.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: In 974 Adud al-Dawla was sent by his father to save his cousin Izz al-Dawla from a rebellion.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: After defeating the rebel forces, he claimed the emirate of Iraq for himself, and forced his cousin to abdicate.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: His father, however, became angered by this decision and restored Izz al-Dawla.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: After the death of Adud al-Dawla's father, his cousin rebelled against him, but was defeated.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: Adud al-Dawla became afterwards the sole ruler of the Buyid dynasty and assumed the ancient Iranian title of Shahanshah ("King of Kings").

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: When Adud al-Dawla became emir of Iraq, the capital city, Baghdad, was suffering from violence and instability owing to sectarian conflict.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: In order to bring peace and stability to the city, he ordered the banning of public demonstrations and polemics.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: At the same time, he patronized a number of Shia scholars such as al-Mufid, and sponsored the renovation of a number of important Shia shrines.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: In addition, 'Adud al-Dawla is credited with sponsoring and patronizing other scientific projects during his time.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: An observatory was built by his orders in Isfahan where Azophi worked.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: Al-Muqaddasi also reports that he ordered the construction of a great dam between Shiraz and Estakhr in 960.

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: The dam irrigated some 300 villages in Fars province and became known as "Band-e Amir" (Dam of the emir).

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: Among his other major constructions was the digging of the Haffar channel, that joined the Karun river to the Shatt al-Arab river (the confluence of the Tigris and the Euphrates).

title: 'Adud al-Dawla
text: The port of Khorramshahr was built on the Haffar, at its joining point with the Shatt al-Arab.

title: Ali ibn Kama
text: Ali ibn Kama, the uncle of the Buyid ruler Rukn al- Dawla and the latter's other brothers Mu'izz al- Dawla and Imad al- Dawla, was a Buyid military officer who became prominent among the Buyids of Jibal, and was greatly honored among his Daylamite kinsmen.

title: Ali ibn Kama
text: At the death of Imad al- Dawla in 949, Ali was appointed as the viceroy of Ray by Rukn al- Dawla, who went to Shiraz to secure the succession of his son there, Adud al- Dawla.

title: Ali ibn Kama
text: Meanwhile, the Samanids used this opportunity to invade the territories of Rukn al- Dawla, forcing Ali to flee from Jibal.

title: Ali ibn Kama
text: In ca. 959, a battle ensured between Ali and the Ziyarid prince Bisutun, which resulted in a Buyid victory.

title: Ali ibn Kama
text: In 966, Ali and Rukn al- Dawla defeated a large force of" ghazis" who had arrived from Khorasan.

title: Ali ibn Kama
text: Rukn al- Dawla later died in 976 and was succeeded by his son Fakhr al- Dawla, who had Ali executed.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: ʿ Azīz al- Dawla Abū Shujāʿ Fātik al- Waḥīd ī ibn ʿ Abd Allāh al- Rūmī, better known simply as Aziz al- Dawla( d. 1022), was the first Fatimid governor of Aleppo in 1016/ 17–1022.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: An ethnic Armenian, Aziz al- Dawla started his political career as a trusted" ghulam"( military slave) of Manjutakin al- Azizi, the Fatimid governor of Damascus during the reign of Caliph al- Hakim( 996–1021).

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: The latter appointed Aziz al- Dawla governor of Aleppo, which experienced prosperity during his rule.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: By 1020, Aziz al- Dawla was acting independently of al- Hakim's authority by issuing coins in his name and having his political sovereignty declared in Friday prayers.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: When al- Hakim sent an army to force Aziz al- Dawla into submission, the latter appealed for Byzantine support but canceled the appeal when al- Hakim mysteriously disappeared in early 1021.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: Afterward, the Fatimid court attempted to reconcile with Aziz al- Dawla, who nonetheless moved to secure his rule by building a well- fortified palace at the foot of the Aleppo's citadel.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: In July 1022, Aziz al- Dawla was murdered in his sleep by one of his" ghulams"( slave soldier) in a plot devised by another of his" ghulams", Abu'l- Najm Badr, with likely backing from al- Hakim's virtual successor, Sitt al- Mulk.

title: Aziz al-Dawla
text: Badr briefly succeeded Aziz al- Dawla as governor but was arrested three months later.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya( also spelled Shahrakawayh), was a high- ranking Gilaki military officer who served the Buyids.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: Ziyar was the son of Shahrakawayh, the son of Harusindan, the maternal uncle of the Ziyarid ruler Mardavij.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: Ziyar had a cousin, who married the Buyid ruler Adud al- Dawla, and bore him one son named Abu Kalijar Marzuban.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: During that period, Ziyar, along with a Daylamite officer named Fuladh ibn Manadhar, dominated the Buyid court of Baghdad.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: After the death of Adud al- Dawla in 983, the Buyid Empire was thrown into civil war; the Empire was disputed between his two sons Abu Kalijar Marzuban( who took the name Samsam al- Dawla) and Sharaf al- Dawla.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: The Turkic soldiers of Iraq shortly betrayed Samsam al- Dawla, and went towards to the court of Sharaf al- Dawla.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: However, Ziyar managed to make most of them change their mind and stay loyal to Samsam al- Dawla.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: In 987, Sharaf al- Dawla marched towards Baghdad and deposed Samsam al- Dawla.

title: Ziyar ibn Shahrakuya
text: He then imprisoned Fuladh and had Ziyar executed.

title: Taj al-Dawla
text: Abu'l-Husain Ahmad , better known by his "laqab" of Taj al-Dawla

title: Taj al-Dawla
text: (Arabic: تاج الدولة،, "Crown of the Dynasty"), was the Buyid ruler of Khuzestan during the 980s.

title: Taj al-Dawla
text: He was the son of 'Adud al-Dawla.

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: Ṣafiyy al- Dawla Muḥammad

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: ibn ʿ Ali ibn Jaʾfar ibn Falāh was the Fatimid governor of Aleppo between October 1022 and April 1023.

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: He was specifically assigned to govern the city, while the citadel of Aleppo was assigned to a separate governor, the eunuch Yumn al- Dawla Sa'adat.

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: This marked the first time the Fatimids appointed separate rulers for the city and citadel of Aleppo since they gained direct control over the city in October 1016.

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: Safiyy al- Dawla belonged to the Kutama, a militant Berber group that played a major role in the Fatimid military, and he was the grandson of the Fatimid general Ja'far ibn Fallah.

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: He was bestowed with the title" ṣafiyy al- dawla"( chosen of the State).

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: Safiyy al- Dawla and Yumn al- Dawla were appointed to Aleppo to replace Abu'l- Najm Badr.

title: Safiyy al-Dawla
text: Nothing is known about their reign and Safiyy al- Dawla was dismissed in April 1023, and succeeded by Sanad al- Dawla Hasan.

title: Curtis Bernhardt
text: Curtis Bernhardt( 15 April 1899 – 22 February 1981) was a German film director born in Worms, Germany, under the name Kurt Bernhardt.

title: Curtis Bernhardt
text: He trained as an actor in Germany, and performed on the stage, before starting as a film director in 1924, with" Nameless Heroes".

title: Curtis Bernhardt
text: Other films include" A Stolen Life"( 1946) and" Sirocco"( 1951).

title: Curtis Bernhardt
text: Bernhardt made films in Germany from 1925 until 1933, when he was forced to flee the Nazi regime — who briefly had him arrested — because he was Jewish.

title: Curtis Bernhardt
text: Bernhardt directed films in France and England before moving on to Hollywood to work for Warner Brothers in 1940.

title: Curtis Bernhardt
text: He produced and directed his last Hollywood picture," Kisses for My President"( 1964), about the nation's first female Chief Executive starring Polly Bergen and Fred MacMurray.

title: Curtis Bernhardt
text: He is interred at Glendale's Forest Lawn Memorial Park Cemetery, near his wife, Pearl Argyle Wellman Bernhardt.

title: Payment on Demand

title: Payment on Demand

title: Thomas William Adams
text: Alfred Albert Thomas William Adams( 24 June 1842 – 1 June 1919), known as Thomas William Adams, was a New Zealand farmer, forester, churchman and educationalist.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: He was born in Graveley, Cambridgeshire, England on 24 June 1842.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: In 1862 he emigrated to New Zealand on the" African".

title: Thomas William Adams
text: He bought of virgin tussock land at Greendale in Canterbury in 1865 and converted them to farmland.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: The area prospered over the next few years as more farmers developed land.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: Adams married Lucy Pannett in 1867 and they had a daughter the following year.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: Lucy drowned in 1869.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: Adams married her sister Harriet in 1872, and they had five sons and three daughters together.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: Adams was a pioneer in planting trials, obtaining seeds from correspondents around the world, keeping records and publishing the results.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: He started planting trees in 1868 for shelter and fuel, and by 1908 had created an arboretum of 800 species.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: His recommendation of" Pinus radiata" and other pines influenced early New Zealand forestry.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: In 1913 he was a member of the Royal Commission on Forestry, and in 1918 he became a lifetime member of the New Zealand Forestry League.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: For 40 years, Adams taught Sunday school at Greendale, which began by teaching local children to read.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: He was instrumental in the formation of the Greendale day school in 1872, and served on the North Canterbury Education Board from 1892 to 1918, serving as chairman from 1897 to 1905.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: He was also a governor of Canterbury College( now University of Canterbury) from 1897 until his death.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: He was the first secretary of the Canterbury Baptist Association, and later its president.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: Adams died at Greendale on 1 June 1919 and was buried there.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: His will left £ 2000 and of land to Canterbury College to be used for a school of forestry.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: Harriet died 15 January 1934 and was buried with him.

title: Thomas William Adams
text: The school of forestry opened in 1924, and about 1975 a T.W. Adams Scholarship was set up to support postgraduate forestry students.

text: Simonds Catholic College is a Roman Catholic school for boys located in Melbourne.

text: The St Mary's campus( years 7- 10) is in West Melbourne and is within walking distance of the Queen Victoria Market.

title: Simonds Catholic College

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: The college is an associate member of the Associated Catholic Colleges History Simonds was formed in 1996 through the amalgamation of Cathedral College, East Melbourne and St Mary's Boys School.

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: In 2010, the former St Brigid's Primary School in North Fitzroy was renovated, and a new senior campus of the college was opened there.

title: Simonds Catholic College
text: The school is named after Justin Simonds, the first ever Australian born Archbishop who served as Archbishop of Melbourne from 1963- 67.

text: Alexandre Berthier had not yet married when he was killed in action at Barenton- sur- Cere during World War I.

title: Gordon Persons
text: Seth Gordon Persons( February 5, 1902 – May 29, 1965) was an American Democratic politician who was the 43rd Governor of Alabama from 1951 to 1955.

title: Gordon Persons
text: He was born and died in Montgomery, Alabama.

title: Gordon Persons
text: The Dauphin Island Bridge south of Mobile is formally named for him.

title: Gordon Persons
text: The Gordon Persons Building is a six floor, 60,000 square foot state government office building in Montgomery.

title: Gordon Persons
text: Persons built a successful business running electrical lines in rural Alabama( benefiting from Rural Electrification Administration contracts); in addition to financial gain, he also won considerable popularity.

title: Gordon Persons
text: When running for office in 1950, Persons gained notoriety by touring the state in a helicopter( prompting one opponent to dub him" the man from Mars").

title: Gordon Persons
text: He won the Democratic nomination by defeating a crowded field that included former governor Chauncey Sparks.

title: Gordon Persons
text: In office, his notable accomplishments included abolishing flogging in Alabama's prisons, advocating for the establishment of Alabama Public Television, and imposing speed limits on state highways.

title: Gordon Persons
text: Persons largely accomplished his goal of having four years of" no fighting," maintaining a truce among the various wings of the state Democratic Party.

title: Gordon Persons
text: At the end of his term, Persons ordered the National Guard into Phenix City following the assassination of Attorney- General- elect Albert Patterson.

title: Gordon Persons
text: After leaving office as governor, Persons never sought statewide public office again, although he did make an unsuccessful run for circuit judge late in life.

title: Gordon Persons
text: Persons was an alumnus of Auburn University, though he attended for only one year.

title: Gordon Persons
text: While at Auburn, Persons served as president of a student organization( known as the" Boxcar Reds and Boxcar Blacks") that traveled to away football games.

title: Lucio Fulci
text: Lucio Fulci( 17 June 1927 – 13 March 1996) was an Italian film director, screenwriter, producer, and actor.

title: Lucio Fulci
text: Although he worked in a wide array of genres through a career spanning nearly five decades, including comedy, spaghetti western, adventure, science fiction and erotica, he garnered an international cult following for his giallo and horror films.

title: Lucio Fulci
text: His most notable films include the" Gates of Hell" trilogy —" City of the Living Dead"( 1980)," The Beyond"( 1981), and" The House by the Cemetery"( 1981) —as well as" Massacre Time"( 1966)," One on Top of the Other"( 1969)," A Lizard in a Woman's Skin"( 1971)," Do n't Torture a Duckling"( 1972)," White Fang"( 1973)," Four of the Apocalypse"( 1975)," Sette note in nero"( 1977)," Zombi 2"( 1979)," Contraband"( 1980)," The Black Cat"( 1981)," The New York Ripper"( 1982)," Murder Rock"( 1984), and" A Cat in the Brain"( 1990).

title: Lucio Fulci
text: Because of the high level of visceral graphic violence present in many of his films, especially" Zombi 2" and" The Beyond", Fulci is frequently referred to as" The Godfather of Gore", a title also given to Herschell Gordon Lewis.

title: Lucio Fulci
text: Fulci was in his young adult years a politically active radical for the Italian Communist Party.

title: Charlie Chan in London

text: This is the sixth film produced by Fox with Warner Oland as the detective, and the second not to be lost, after" The Black Camel"( 1931).

title: Charlie Chan in London
text: Robert Altman's film" Gosford Park", set in 1932, features a( fictional) character who produces the Chan films for Fox and claims to be in England doing research for" Charlie Chan in London".

title: The House by the Cemetery

title: Layne Tom Jr.

title: Layne Tom Jr.
text: He holds the sole distinction of having played three different Charlie Chan sons: as Charlie Chan Jr. in" Charlie Chan at the Olympics"( 1937), as Tommy Chan in" Charlie Chan in Honolulu"( 1938), and in 1940's" Charlie Chan's Murder Cruise" as Willie Chan, Chan's number seven son.

title: Layne Tom Jr.

title: Layne Tom Jr.
text: After he got out of the Navy when World War II ended, he turned down a five- year movie contract with Monogram Pictures to go to college instead to become an architect.

text: Nicos Poulantzas( 21 September 1936 – 3 October 1979) was a Greek- French Marxist political sociologist and philosopher.

title: Nicos Poulantzas
text: In the 1970s, Poulantzas was known, along with Louis Althusser, as a leading Structural Marxist and, while at first a Leninist, eventually became a proponent of eurocommunism.

title: Nicos Poulantzas
text: He is most well known for his theoretical work on the state, but he also offered Marxist contributions to the analysis of fascism, social class in the contemporary world, and the collapse of dictatorships in Southern Europe in the 1970s( e.g., Franco's rule in Spain, Salazar's in Portugal, and Papadopoulos' in Greece).

title: Francesco Ruschi

text: He studied in Rome under Giuseppe Cesari( Cavalier d' Arpino), Francesco Albani and Pietro da Cortona.

title: Francesco Ruschi

text: ( February 1568 – 3 July 1640) was an Italian Mannerist painter, also named Il Giuseppino and called Cavaliere d' Arpino, because he was created" Cavaliere di Cristo" by his patron Pope Clement VIII.

title: Maximus of Tyre
text: Maximus of Tyre( fl. late 2nd century AD), also known as Cassius Maximus Tyrius, was a Greek rhetorician and philosopher who lived in the time of the Antonines and Commodus, and who belongs to the trend of the Second Sophistic.

title: Maximus of Tyre
text: His writings contain many allusions to the history of Greece, while there is little reference to Rome; hence it is inferred that he lived longer in Greece, perhaps as a professor at Athens.

title: Maximus of Tyre
text: Although nominally a Platonist, he is really an Eclectic and one of the precursors of Neoplatonism.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: According to Hasidic legend, Adam Baal Shem of Ropczyce was a rabbi and mystic who first introduced the movement of Hasidism.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: The leadership of the movement was later handed down from Rabbi Adam to Rabbi Yisrael ben Eliezer, the Baal Shem Tov.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: The exact identity of Rabbi Adam is unknown.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: Since the name Adam was rare among European Jewry, Gershom Scholem considers it to be a pseudonym for Heshel Zoref( died 1700).

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: According to Aryeh Kaplan, others identify this Adam with Rabbi David Moshe Abraham( whose initials are Adam) of Troyes or with Adam Zerweiker.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: Kaplan also writes that it may be an anonym to protect the subject's identity.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: According to Rabbi Yosef Yitzchak Schneersohn, Rabbi Adam was a disciple of Rabbi Yoel Baal Shem of Zamość, who in turn was a disciple of Rabbi Eliyahu Baal Shem of Worms.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: According to the" Shivhei HaBesht", Rabbi Adam found manuscripts in a cave, containing hidden secrets of the Torah.

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: Rabbi Adam asked in a dream to whom should he hand down the manuscripts?

title: Adam Baal Shem
text: He was answered to hand them down to Rabbi Israel ben Eliezer of the city of Okopy.

text: He toured the Caribbean in May 2005, and has retained his place for the upcoming England series.

title: Arshad Khan (cricketer)
text: During the 2005 One Day International series against England, Arshad was used in the second and fifth matches and proved effective at repressing the England batsmen, allowing very few runs to be scored off him and also taking wickets.

title: Arshad Khan (cricketer)
text: During the fifth match, his economy was just over 3 runs per over – a very good figure for any bowler, especially a spinner.

title: Arshad Khan (cricketer)
text: A tall man at 6'4", Arshad bowls in a classical off-spinner's mould, preferring a nagging line to any great variation.

title: Arshad Khan (cricketer)
text: Khan now lives in Sydney, Australia.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: Douglas Leiterman (1927 – 19 December 2012) was a Canadian television producer.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He was born in 1927 in South Porcupine, Ontario.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: During the early 1950s, he attended the University of British Columbia for a Bachelor of Arts degree, while also working as a "Vancouver Province" reporter.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He had a brother, cinematographer Richard Leiterman, and a sister, Elaine Campbell, who was married to producer Norman Campbell.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: His sister Phyllis, a teacher and poet, was married to acclaimed film director Allan King.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He had a sister Mary, a teacher and founder of a school, who was married to renowned Ibiza architect and artist Rolph Blakstad.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He attended Harvard University in 1954 on a Nieman Fellowship.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: Leiterman had five children with his first wife, Mary.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He toured Eastern Europe with Mary in 1955.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: In 1968 he divorced Mary and married Beryl Fox, who had worked for him at CBC, and had one daughter.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: Leiterman got his start in journalism in British Columbia, before becoming a correspondent on Parliament Hill in Ottawa for the Southam News Service.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: His television credits include "This Hour Has Seven Days" which he co-produced with Patrick Watson from 1964 to 1966.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: It was the second most popular CBC program.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: After that series was cancelled, Leiterman joined CBS to provide advice for the development of the "60 Minutes" series.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He produced a special "Sixteen in Webster Grove" for CBS.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He produced other series such as "The Fabulous Sixties" and "Here Come the Seventies" (CTV, 1969-1972).

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He produced documentaries for the United Nations and a nature film documentary series.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He founded WIred CIty Communications, a cable company in Toronto, in the 1970s.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He founded Motion Picture Guarantors Inc., in the 1970s in Canada and The Motion PIcture Bond Company Ltd., in the 1980s, the second largest completion bond company in the world for motion pictures.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He operated both companies internationally and bonded such films as "Peter The Great" and TV series such as "Baywatch".

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He sold MPB to AIG in the early 2000s.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: Leiterman died at his winter residence in Vero Beach, Florida on 19 December 2012.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He was survived by his partner of 50 years, documentary filmmaker Beryl Fox and their daughter and three of his daughters from his first marriage.

title: Douglas Leiterman
text: He was predeceased by his first wife Mary and two of their five children, Mark and Lisa.

text: Margaret Douglas, Countess of Douglas( died c. 1474), known as the Fair Maid of Galloway, was a Scottish noblewoman, a member of the Black Douglas family towards the end of the family's position as a major force in Scotland.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: She was the daughter of Archibald Douglas, 5th Earl of Douglas, and Eupheme Graham, daughter of Patrick Graham, Earl of Strathearn and Euphemia Stewart, Countess of Strathearn.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: She acquired Galloway when her two brothers( one of whom was William Douglas, 6th Earl of Douglas) were murdered at the Black Dinner in Edinburgh Castle.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: She married her cousin William Douglas, 8th Earl of Douglas.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: When he was assassinated she obtained permission to marry his brother, James Douglas, 9th Earl of Douglas, but it is not entirely clear that the marriage ever happened, if it did it must have ended in divorce since they both married again.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: She then married John Stewart, 1st Earl of Atholl.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: She had no children by the Earls of Douglas, but two daughters by the Earl of Atholl.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: These were Janet, wife of Alexander Gordon, 3rd Earl of Huntly and Elizabeth, wife of Andrew Gray, 2nd Lord Gray.

title: Margaret Douglas, Fair Maid of Galloway
text: They both had issue by their respective husbands.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: Born and raised in Fukuoka, Fukuoka Prefecture, Hamasaki moved to Tokyo at fourteen in 1993 to pursue a career in singing and acting.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: In 1998, under the tutelage of Avex CEO Max Matsuura, Hamasaki released her debut single "Poker Face" and debut major-label album "A Song for XX".

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: The album debuted at the top of the Oricon charts and remained there for five weeks, selling over a million copies.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: Her next ten albums shipped over a million copies in Japan, with her third, "Duty," selling nearly three million.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: A Best", her first compilation album, is her best-selling album, with more than four million copies sold in Japan.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: Since 2006, after her album "Secret" was released, album and single sales have declined.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: Hamasaki has sold over 80 million records, making her the best-selling Japanese solo artist of all time.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: During the height of her career, Hamasaki was dubbed the "Empress of J-pop" because of her popularity in Japan and Asia.

title: Ayumi Hamasaki
text: Following an ear infection in 2000, she has suffered worsening hearing loss and is completely deaf in one ear.

title: O Valencia!

title: O Valencia!
text: The Decemberists, and the first released from their fourth studio album," The Crane Wife".

title: O Valencia!
text: The music was written by The Decemberists and the lyrics by Colin Meloy.

title: O Valencia!
text: It tells a story of two star- crossed lovers.

title: O Valencia!
text: The singer falls in love with a person who belongs to an opposing gang.

title: O Valencia!

title: Who...
text: "Who..." is a Japanese-language song recorded by singer Ayumi Hamasaki.

title: Who...
text: It served as a standard track to her second studio album "Loveppears" (1999), and was re-recorded and released as a promotional single by Avex Trax in Japan as part of the promotion towards her fifth greatest hits compilation album on September 10, 2008.

title: Who...
text: The track was written by Hamasaki herself, while production was handled by long-time collaborator Max Matsuura.

title: Who...
text: Musically, it is a J-Pop ballad that was written in third-person perspective, like the rest of the content from "Loveppears".

title: Who...
text: The lyrics details the encapsulation of Hamasaki, and explaining her message of her own philosophy.

title: Who...
text: During its promotional release in 2008, it reached number 49 on the "Billboard" Adult Alternative Songs chart in Japan, and number 19 on the RIAJ Monthly Ringtones chart.

title: Who...
text: It was certified Platinum by the Recording Industry Association of Japan (RIAJ) for digital sales of 250,000 units.

title: Who...
text: To promote the single, it appeared on remix and greatest hits compilation albums conducted by Hamasaki.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: Alexandre "Sacha" Gaydamak (born May 1976 in France) is a French and Israeli businessman.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: A member of the wealthy Gaydamak family, he is the only son of Arcadi Gaydamak.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: In January 2006 he announced that he was following his father into association football club ownership by becoming co-owner of English Premier League club Portsmouth F.C. with Milan Mandarić.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: His father was the owner of Israeli side Beitar Jerusalem.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: In July 2006 Alexandre Gaydamak became the sole owner of Portsmouth, although Mandarić remained at the club as non-executive chairman until later that year.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: Gaydamak owns a Luxembourg-based company, Belvia SARL and a British Virgin Islands company, Devondale Investments, which owned Portsmouth F.C.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: On 21 July 2009, Gaydamak agreed to sell Portsmouth F.C. to Sulaiman Al Fahim in principle, and therefore stepped down from the board.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: He remained the owner of the club until the details of the sale had been finalised on 8 June 2009.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: Gaydamak has been alleged to have asset stripped Portsmouth F.C. before this sale and yet still retains a claim, said to be £32,000,000, against the club as a creditor despite the huge debts at the club.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: Investigations into these allegations are ongoing.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: On 22 October 2010 Gaydamak's business acumen came into question after reports of him demanding a payment from his former club Portsmouth for an apparent £2.5million.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: It seems that he was unsure that his unpaid debt would be repaid.

title: Alexandre Gaydamak
text: The case was made more embarrassing after Portsmouth F.C had received confirmation several times from Gaydamak himself that the terms were agreed and that he was a secured creditor meaning that not only would be paid in full, but he would also be paid before many unsecured creditors who are set to only receive 20% of any debt.

title: Mikhail Gaydamak

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: Arcadi Aleksandrovich Gaydamak (born 8 April 1952 in Moscow, USSR) is a Russian-born French-Israeli businessman, philanthropist, and President of the Congress of Jewish Religious Communities and Organizations of Russia (KEROOR).

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: He emigrated to Israel at the age of 20 and lived on a kibbutz, then moved to France and opened a translation bureau.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: In the 1990s he was awarded the French "Ordre national du Mérite" and the "Ordre du Mérite agricole" for actions taken to rescue personnel in the War in Bosnia.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: In the AngolaGate scandal, he was convicted of failure to declare income.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: On November 24, 2015, he started serving a prison sentence at Fresnes prison in France for that tax issue.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: In the early 21st century, Gaydamak returned to Israel, where he founded Social Justice, a movement that became a political party.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: He ran for mayor of Jerusalem but did not win.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: He bought Hapoel Jerusalem, a professional basketball club.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: He also bought two newspapers, one in France and one in Russia.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: He directed the latter to take a pro-government/Vladimir Putin editorial stance.

title: Arcadi Gaydamak
text: In Israel he has been a generous philanthropist.

title: Henry IV of France
text: Henry IV (read as ; 13 December 1553 – 14 May 1610), also known by the epithet Good King Henry or Henry the Great, was King of Navarre (as Henry III) from 1572 and King of France from 1589 to 1610.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He was the first monarch of France from the House of Bourbon, a cadet branch of the Capetian dynasty.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He was assassinated in 1610 by François Ravaillac, a fanatical Catholic, and was succeeded by his son Louis XIII.

title: Henry IV of France
text: The son of Antoine de Bourbon, Duke of Vendôme and Jeanne d'Albret, the Queen of Navarre, Henry was baptised as a Catholic but raised in the Protestant faith by his mother.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He inherited the throne of Navarre in 1572 on his mother's death.

title: Henry IV of France
text: As a Huguenot, Henry was involved in the French Wars of Religion, barely escaping assassination in the St. Bartholomew's Day massacre.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He later led Protestant forces against the royal army.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He and his predecessor Henry III of France were direct descendants of Saint-King Louis IX.

title: Henry IV of France
text: Henry III belonged to the House of Valois, descended from Philip III of France, elder son of Saint Louis; Henry IV belonged to the House of Bourbon, descended from Robert, Count of Clermont, younger son of Saint Louis.

title: Henry IV of France
text: As Head of the House of Bourbon, Henry was "first prince of the blood".

title: Henry IV of France
text: Upon the death of his brother-in-law and distant cousin Henry III in 1589, Henry was called to the French succession by the Salic law.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He initially kept the Protestant faith (the only French king to do so) and had to fight against the Catholic League, which denied that he could wear France's crown as a Protestant.

title: Henry IV of France
text: To obtain mastery over his kingdom, after four years of stalemate, he found it prudent to abjure the Calvinist faith.

title: Henry IV of France
text: As a pragmatic politician (in the parlance of the time, a "politique"), he displayed an unusual religious tolerance for the era.

title: Henry IV of France
text: Notably, he promulgated the Edict of Nantes (1598), which guaranteed religious liberties to Protestants, thereby effectively ending the Wars of Religion.

title: Henry IV of France
text: Considered a usurper by some Catholics and a traitor by some Protestants, Henry became target of at least 12 assassination attempts.

title: Henry IV of France
text: An unpopular king among his contemporaries, Henry gained more status after his death.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He was admired for his repeated victories over his enemies and his conversion to Catholicism.

title: Henry IV of France
text: The "Good King Henryle bon roi Henri") was remembered for his geniality and his great concern about the welfare of his subjects.

title: Henry IV of France
text: An active ruler, he worked to regularise state finance, promote agriculture, eliminate corruption and encourage education.

title: Henry IV of France
text: During his reign, the French colonization of the Americas truly began with the foundation of the colony of Acadia and its capital Port-Royal.

title: Henry IV of France
text: He was celebrated in the popular song "Vive le roi Henri" (which later became an anthem for the French monarchy during the reigns of his successors) and in Voltaire's "Henriade".

title: Prince Henri of Orléans
text: Prince Henri of Orléans( 16 October 1867 – 9 August 1901) was the son of Prince Robert, Duke of Chartres, and Princess Françoise of Orléans.

title: Gaston, Duke of Orléans
text: Gaston, Duke of Orléans (24 April 1608 – 2 February 1660), was the third son of King Henry IV of France and his wife Marie de' Medici.

title: Gaston, Duke of Orléans
text: As a son of the king, he was born a "Fils de France".

title: Gaston, Duke of Orléans
text: He later acquired the title Duke of Orléans, by which he was generally known during his adulthood.

title: Gaston, Duke of Orléans
text: As the eldest surviving brother of King Louis XIII, he was known at court by the traditional honorific Monsieur.

title: Hannah Arnold

title: Charles, Duke of Orléans
text: Charles of Orléans( 24 November 1394 – 5 January 1465) was Duke of Orléans from 1407, following the murder of his father, Louis I, Duke of Orléans, on the orders of John the Fearless, Duke of Burgundy.

title: Charles, Duke of Orléans
text: He was also Duke of Valois, Count of Beaumont- sur- Oise and of Blois, Lord of Coucy, and the inheritor of Asti in Italy via his mother Valentina Visconti, daughter of Gian Galeazzo Visconti, Duke of Milan.

title: Charles, Duke of Orléans
text: He is now remembered as an accomplished medieval poet owing to the more than five hundred extant poems he produced, written in both French and English, during his 25 years spent as a prisoner of war and after his return to France.

title: Philip, Count of Vertus

title: Philip, Duke of Orléans
text: His father named him Duke of Orléans, a newly created duchy, in 1344.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: Hans Barthold Andresen Butenschøn( 27 December 1877 – 28 November 1971) was a Norwegian businessperson.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He was born in Kristiania as a son of Nils August Andresen Butenschøn and Hanna Butenschøn, and grandson of Nicolay Andresen.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: Together with Mabel Anette Plahte( 1877 – 1973, a daughter of Frithjof M. Plahte) he had the son Hans Barthold Andresen Butenschøn Jr. and was through him the father- in- law of Ragnhild Butenschøn and grandfather of Peter Butenschøn.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: Through his daughter Marie Claudine he was the father- in- law of Joakim Lehmkuhl, through his daughter Mabel Anette he was the father- in- law of Harald Astrup( a son of Sigurd Astrup) and through his daughter Nini Augusta he was the father- in- law of Ernst Torp.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He took commerce school and agricultural school.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He was hired in the family company N. A. Andresen& Co, and became a co-owner in 1910.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He eventually became chief executive officer.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: The bank changed its name to Andresens Bank in 1913 and merged with Bergens Kreditbank in 1920.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: The merger was dissolved later in the 1920s.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He was also a landowner, owning Nedre Skøyen farm and a lot of land in Enebakk.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He chaired the board of Nydalens Compagnie from 1926, having not been a board member before that.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He also chaired the supervisory council of Forsikringsselskapet Viking and Nedre Glommen salgsforening, and was a supervisory council member of Filharmonisk Selskap.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He was a member of the gentlemen's club SK Fram since 1890, and was proclaimed a lifetime member in 1964.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He was buried in Enebakk.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: Werner( Garnier, Warin)( died 973), Count of Valenciennes and Count of Hesbaye and Zülpich, brother of Renaud, Count of Mons.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: His parentage is unknown.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: In 953, Reginar III was defeated by King Lothair and Archbishop Bruno, and banished to Bavaria.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: At that time, Werner became the successor of Rudolf as Count of Hesbaye, Werner, is referred to as count in a charter confirmed by Bruno.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: Before 966, it appears that at least some of Rudolf's property was confiscated and placed under Werner.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: After the disgrace of Count Reginar III, Godfrey I, Duke of Lower Lorraine, received the County of Hainaut, which included the cities of Mons and Valenciennes.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: After the death of Godfrey, Amaury became Count of Valenciennes, while Richer assumed the countship of Mons.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: After the death of Amaury, Emperor Otto I appointed Werner as the Count of Valenciennes.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: Returning from exile in 973, the sons of Reginar III, Reginar IV, Count of Mons, and Lambert I, Count of Louvain, killed both Werner and his brother Renaud at the battle of Peronne.

title: Werner, Count of Valenciennes
text: Werner had no known children.

title: Otto I, Margrave of Meissen
text: Otto I was the Margrave of Meissen from 1062 until his death in 1067, and the second Margrave of the family of the counts of Weimar and Orlamünde.

title: Otto I, Margrave of Meissen
text: He was a younger son of William III of Weimar and Oda, daughter of Thietmar, Margrave of the Saxon Ostmark.

title: Otto I, Margrave of Meissen
text: He inherited Orlamünde from his father in 1039 and Weimar from his brother William in 1062.

title: Otto I, Margrave of Meissen

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: Lambert II, Count of Lens( died 1054) was a French nobleman.

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: He was likely born circa 1030.

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: This would put his death age at about 24 years old.

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: He was the son of Eustace I, Count of Bologne and of Maud of Louvain( daughter of Lambert I of Louvain).

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: he married Adelaide of Normandy, Countess of Aumale, daughter of Robert I, Duke of Normandy and sister of William the Conqueror.

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: Adelaide was the widow of Enguerrand II, Count of Ponthieu who died in 1053.

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: Lambert and Adelaide had a daughter, Judith of Lens, although Lambert would scarcely have seen her; he was killed at the battle of Lille in 1054.

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: Lambert was supporting Baldwin V, Count of Flanders against Henry III, Holy Roman Emperor when he was killed in battle.

title: Lambert II, Count of Lens
text: His widow, Adelaide, married thirdly, Odo, Count of Champagne.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: Sigramnus (Sigrand), was the Count of Hesbaye.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: Sigramnus became Count of Hesbaye by virtue of his marriage to the daughter of Lambert, Count of Hesbaye.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: The dates of his rule are unknown but are believed to be between that of Lambert’s son and grandson, and so it was perhaps an interim position until the latter became of age.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: The only knowledge available on Sigramnus is through his son, the Bishop of Metz, and grandson Ingerman of Hesbaye, father of Ermengard, wife of Louis the Pious.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: Sigramnus is known to have been an early supporter of Charles Martel, even before the Battle of Amblève.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: Sigramnus married , daughter of Lambert, Count of Hesbaye.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: They had three children: Previous histories have portrayed Sigramnus as the husband of the daughter of Charles Martel, but this has been largely discredited.

title: Sigramnus, Count of Hesbaye
text: Sigramnus was succeeded by his nephew Cancor as Count of Hesbaye.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: Reginar III (c. 920 – 973) was a Count of Hainaut from approximately 940 until his exile in 958.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: He was the son of Reginar II, Count of Hainaut.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: He took part in the rebellion of his uncle Gilbert, Duke of Lorraine.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: When Gilbert was killed in 939, Regnier had to pledge fealty to King Otto the Great.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: He then allied himself with King Louis IV of France, but King Otto sent duke Hermann of Swabia to quell the rebels in 944.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: Otto appointed Conrad the Red as duke of Lotharingia, who tried to diminish the power of Reginar.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: However, when Conrad rose against Otto, Reginar supported him.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: In an anarchic situation, Reginar appropriated the dowry of Gerberga of Saxony, Otto's sister and mother of the French king, and also church property.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: In 953, Bruno, Archbishop of Cologne, who had also been appointed duke of Lotharingia, restored order and defeated Reginar.

title: Reginar III, Count of Hainaut
text: As Reginar refused to submit, he was exiled to Bohemia, where he died.

title: Princess Lida of Thurn and Taxis
text: Lida, Princess Victor of Thurn and Taxis( née Lida Eleanor Nicolls; July 28, 1875 – December 6, 1965), also styled as Princess Lida of Thurn and Taxis, was an American millionairess, socialite, and the wife of Prince Victor of Thurn and Taxis.

title: Princess Lida of Thurn and Taxis
text: She was well known for her involvement in several highly publicized legal disputes, making her a fixture in newspapers such as" The New York Times".

title: Princess Lida of Thurn and Taxis
text: The first such dispute was with former New York showgirl Josephine Moffitt, who claimed to be the legal spouse of Prince Victor using the name" Josephine, Princess of Thurn and Taxis" and the second was with Bernard Francis S. Gregory, who sued her for$ 50,000, alleging she had slandered him.

title: O Valencia!
text: " O Valencia!" is the fifth single by the indie rock band

title: O Valencia!
text: The Decemberists, and the first released from their fourth studio album," The Crane Wife".

title: O Valencia!
text: The music was written by The Decemberists and the lyrics by Colin Meloy.

title: O Valencia!
text: It tells a story of two star- crossed lovers.

title: O Valencia!
text: The singer falls in love with a person who belongs to an opposing gang.

title: O Valencia!
text: At the end of the song, the singer's lover jumps in to defend the singer, who is confronting his lover's brother( the singer's" sworn enemy") and is killed by the bullet intended for the singer.

title: Sunday Papers
text: "Sunday Papers" is a song written and performed by British new wave musician Joe Jackson.

title: Sunday Papers
text: It was released on his debut album, "Look Sharp!".

title: Sunday Papers
text: Written as a critique of the British press, "Sunday Papers" features mocking lyrics and reggae inspired music.

title: Sunday Papers
text: "Sunday Papers" was released as a single in the UK as the follow-up to his single, "Is She Really Going Out with Him?", but did not chart.

title: Sunday Papers
text: Despite this, the song has generally received positive critical reception.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God?" first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is?" illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God?" was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The other current books in the" What is?" series include

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Love?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Death?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Beautiful?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Funny?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Right?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Peace?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Money?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Dreaming?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Friend?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is True?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Family?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Feeling?"

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The series is now also translated into 15 languages.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He has helped numerous other authors to get published through" How to Get Your Book Published!" programs.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer is also a yoga teacher who teaches regular classes locally and guest- teaches nationally.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He is also recognized nationally as an erudite speaker on" The Teachings of the Buddha."

text: Having spent years studying music and playing clubs, Jackson scored a hit with his first release, "Is She Really Going Out with Him?", in 1979.

title: Joe Jackson (musician)
text: This was followed by a number of new wave singles before he moved to more jazz-inflected pop music and had a Top 10 hit in 1982 with "Steppin' Out".

title: Joe Jackson (musician)
text: He is associated with the 1980s Second British Invasion of the US.

title: Joe Jackson (musician)
text: He has also composed classical music.

title: Joe Jackson (musician)
text: He has recorded 19 studio albums and received 5 Grammy Award nominations.

title: Caspar Babypants
text: Caspar Babypants is the stage name of children's music artist Chris Ballew, who is also widely known as the singer of The Presidents of the United States of America.

title: Bernie Bonvoisin
text: Bernard Bonvoisin, known as Bernie Bonvoisin( born 9 July 1956 in Nanterre, Hauts- de- Seine), is a French hard rock singer and film director.

title: Bernie Bonvoisin
text: He was one of the best friends of Bon Scott the singer of AC/ DC and together they recorded the song" Ride On" which was one of the last songs by Bon Scott.

title: Billy Milano

title: Billy Milano
text: He is the singer and- occasionally- guitarist and bassist of crossover thrash band M.O.D., and he was also the singer of its predecessor, Stormtroopers of Death.

title: Billy Milano
text: He was also the singer of United Forces, which also featured his Stormtroopers of Death bandmate Dan Lilker.

text: Kristian Leontiou (born February 1982) is a British singer of Greek Cypriot descent, and is the singer for the indie rock band One eskimO.

text: Dodging the Clock is a Quebec film directed by Ricardo Trogi and released in 2005.

title: John McMahon (Surrey and Somerset cricketer)
text: John William Joseph McMahon( 28 December 1917 – 8 May 2001) was an Australian- born first- class cricketer who played for Surrey and Somerset in England from 1947 to 1957.

title: Carlos Saura
text: Carlos Saura Atarés( born 4 January 1932) is a Spanish film director, photographer and writer.

title: Carlos Saura
text: Along with Luis Buñuel and Pedro Almodóvar, he is counted among the Spain ’s three most renowned filmmakers.

title: Carlos Saura
text: He has a long and prolific career that spans over half a century.

title: Carlos Saura
text: Several of his films have won many international awards.

title: Carlos Saura
text: Saura began his career in 1955 making documentary shorts.

title: Carlos Saura
text: He quickly gained international prominence when his first feature- length film premiered at Cannes Film Festival in 1960.

title: Carlos Saura
text: Although he started filming as a neorealist, Saura quickly switched to films encoded with metaphors and symbolism in order to get around the Spanish censors.

title: Carlos Saura
text: In 1966, he was thrust into the international spotlight when his film" La Caza" won the Silver Bear at the Berlin International Film Festival.

title: Carlos Saura
text: In the following years, he forged an international reputation for his cinematic treatment of emotional and spiritual responses to repressive political conditions.

title: Carlos Saura
text: By the 1970s, Saura was the best known filmmaker working in Spain.

title: Carlos Saura
text: His films employed complex narrative devices and were frequently controversial.

title: Carlos Saura
text: He won Special Jury Awards for" La Prima Angélica"( 1973) and" Cría Cuervos"( 1975) in Cannes; and an Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film nomination in 1979 for" Mama Cumple 100 Años".

title: Carlos Saura
text: In the 1980s, Saura was in the spotlight for his Flamenco trilogy –" Bodas de SangreCarmen" and" El Amor Brujo," in which he combined dramatic content and flamenco dance forms.

title: Carlos Saura
text: His work continued to be featured in worldwide competitions and earned numerous awards.

title: Carlos Saura
text: He received two nominations for Academy Awards for Best Foreign Language Film, for" Carmen"( 1983) and" Tango"( 1998).

title: Carlos Saura
text: His films are sophisticated expression of time and space fusing reality with fantasy, past with present, and memory with hallucination.

title: Carlos Saura
text: In the last two decades of the 20th century, Saura has concentrated on works uniting music, dance and images.

title: Wale Adebanwi

title: Dodging the Dole
text: Dodging the Dole is a 1936 British musical comedy film directed by John E. Blakeley and starring Roy Barbour, Dan Young and Jenny Howard.

title: Dodging the Dole
text: It was made by Mancunian Films at Highbury Studios and Southall Studios.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: John E. Blakeley

title: John E. Blakeley
text: ( 1 October 1888 – 20 February 1958) was a British film producer, director and screenwriter, the founder of Mancunian Films.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: Born in Ardwick, Manchester, son of James Blakeley( born c. 1862; Manchester), and Margaret Quirk( born c. 1861; Glasgow, Scotland), he was of Lancashire( Church of England) descent on his father's side of the family and Irish Catholic on his mother's.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: His father had become an early film distributor in 1908 after previous work as a travelling draper.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: Blakeley joined his father's business and soon came to understand the tastes of the emerging cinema audiences in the northern industrial towns.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: By the 1930s, the younger Blakeley was making films starring the idols of northern music hall comedy: George Formby, Frank Randle and Sandy Powell.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: Initially relying on London studios, rising costs encouraged him to found the Mancunian Film Studios in his hometown in 1947, on £ 70,000 capital.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: The studios produced a sequence of profitable films, often on shoestring budgets, until Blakeley's retirement in 1953.

title: John E. Blakeley
text: He died in Stockport aged 69.

title: Antonieta

title: Antonieta
text: The plot centers on the life of Antonieta Rivas Mercado, a Mexican writer who killed herself inside Paris' Notre Dame in 1931.
