title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: Luis Vélez de Guevara( born Luis Vélez de Santander)

title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: ( 1 August 1579 – 10 November 1644) was a Spanish dramatist and novelist.

title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: He was born at Écija and was of Jewish converso descent.

title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: After graduating as a sizar at the University of Osuna in 1596, he joined the household of Rodrigo de Castro, Cardinal- Archbishop of Seville, and celebrated the marriage of Philip III in a poem signed Vélez de Santander, a name which he continued to use till some years later.

title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: It seems he served as a soldier in Italy and Algiers, returning to Spain in 1602 when he entered the service of the count de Saldaña, and dedicated himself to writing for the stage.

title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: He died at Madrid on 10 November 1644.

title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: Velez de Guevara was the author of over four hundred plays, of which the best are" Reinar despues de morirLa Luna de la Sierra", and" El Diablo está en Cantillana".

title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: The play" Más pesa el rey que la sangre", which translates into" The King weighs more than blood( kinship)" is based on the episode of the Reconquista in which the nobleman Alonso Pérez de Guzmán allows his son to be sacrificed, rather than surrender his King's possession of Tarifa.

title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: However, Vélez de Guevara is most widely known as the author of" El diablo cojuelo"( 1641," The Lame Devil" or" The Crippled Devil"), a fantastic novel which suggested to Alain- René Lesage the idea for" Le Diable boiteux"( 1707).

title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: The plot presents a rascal student that hides in an astrologer's mansard.

title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: He frees a devil from a bottle.

title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: As an acknowledgement the devil shows him the apartments of Madrid and the tricks, miseries and mischiefs of their inhabitants.

title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: A similar theme was suggested by the magic lenses in" Los anteojos de mejor vista"( 1620 – 1625) by Rodrigo Fernández de Ribera.

title: Luis Vélez de Guevara
text: Charles Dickens refers to" El Diablo cojuelo" in The Old Curiosity Shop, chapter thirty- three.

title: Eystein Glumra
text: Eystein Glumra(" Eystein the Noisy" or" Eystein the Clatterer"; Modern Norwegian" Øystein Glumra") also known as Eystein Ivarsson, was reputedly a petty king on the west coast of Norway, during the 9th Century.

title: Eystein Glumra
text: The" Heimskringla" saga states that Eystein Glumra was the father of Rognvald Eysteinsson and Sigurd Eysteinsson:" The first earl in the Orkney Islands was called Sigurd, who was a son of Eystein Glumra, and brother of Ragnvald earl of More.

title: Eystein Glumra
text: After Sigurd, his son Guthorm was earl for one year.

title: Eystein Glumra
text: After him Torf- Einar, a son of Ragnvald, took the earldom, and was long earl, and was a man of great power".

title: Eystein Glumra
text: According to the" Orkneyinga Saga", Eystein Glumra was the son of Ivar the jarl of Uplanders and grandson of Halfdan the Old.

title: Eystein Glumra
text: " Orkneyinga Saga" also named Eystein Glumra as the father of Rognvald Eysteinsson:" Heiti, Gorr ’s son, was father of Sveiði the sea-king, the father of Halfdan the old, the father of Ivar the Uplanders ’ earl, the father of Eystein the noisy, the father of earl Rognvald the mighty and wise in council".

title: Eystein Glumra
text: Linnea Hartsuyker's books

title: Gene Fowler Jr.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: The Yongle Emperor (pronounced , ; 2 May 1360 – 12 August 1424) — personal name Zhu Di

title: Yongle Emperor
text: (WG: Chu Ti) — was the third Emperor of the Ming dynasty, reigned from 1402 to 1424.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: Zhu Di was the fourth son of the Hongwu Emperor, the founder of the Ming dynasty.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: He was originally enfeoffed as the Prince of Yan in May 1370, with the capital of his princedom at Beiping (modern Beijing).

title: Yongle Emperor
text: Amid the continuing struggle against the Mongols of the Northern Yuan dynasty, Zhu Di consolidated his own power and eliminated rivals such as the general Lan Yu.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: He initially accepted his father's appointment of his eldest brother Zhu Biao and then his nephew Zhu Yunwen as crown prince, but when Zhu Yunwen ascended the throne as the Jianwen Emperor and began executing and demoting his powerful uncles, Zhu Di found pretext for rising in rebellion against his nephew.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: Assisted in large part by eunuchs mistreated by the Hongwu and Jianwen Emperors, who both favored the Confucian scholar-bureaucrats, Zhu Di survived the initial attacks on his princedom and drove south to launch the Jingnan Campaign against the Jianwen Emperor in Nanjing.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: In 1402, he successfully overthrew his nephew and occupied the imperial capital, Nanjing, after which he was proclaimed Emperor and adopted the era name Yongle, which means "perpetual happiness".

title: Yongle Emperor
text: Eager to establish his own legitimacy, Zhu Di voided the Jianwen Emperor's reign and established a wide-ranging effort to destroy or falsify records concerning his childhood and rebellion.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: This included a massive purge of the Confucian scholars in Nanjing and grants of extraordinary extralegal authority to the eunuch secret police.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: One favorite was Zheng He, who employed his authority to launch major voyages of exploration into the South Pacific and Indian Oceans.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: The difficulties in Nanjing also led the Yongle Emperor to re-establish Beiping (present-day Beijing) as the new imperial capital.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: He repaired and reopened the Grand Canal and, between 1406 and 1420, directed the construction of the Forbidden City.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: He was also responsible for the Porcelain Tower of Nanjing, considered one of the wonders of the world before its destruction by the Taiping rebels in 1856.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: As part of his continuing attempt to control the Confucian scholar-bureaucrats, the Yongle Emperor also greatly expanded the imperial examination system in place of his father's use of personal recommendation and appointment.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: These scholars completed the monumental "Yongle Encyclopedia" during his reign.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: The Yongle Emperor died while personally leading a military campaign against the Mongols.

title: Yongle Emperor
text: He was buried in the Changling Tomb, the central and largest mausoleum of the Ming tombs located north of Beijing.

title: Kabani Nadi Chuvannappol

title: When the Mountains Tremble
text: When The Mountains Tremble is a 1983 documentary film produced by Skylight Pictures about the war between the Guatemalan Military and the Mayan Indigenous population of Guatemala.

title: When the Mountains Tremble
text: Footage from this film was used as forensic evidence in the Guatemalan court for crimes against humanity, in the genocide case against Efraín Ríos Montt.

title: When the Mountains Tremble
text: The film centers on the experiences of Nobel Prize winner Rigoberta Menchú, a Quiché indigenous woman who won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1992, nine years after the film came out.

title: When the Mountains Tremble

title: When the Mountains Tremble
text: A follow- up film was released in 2011, titled" Granito: How to Nail a Dictator".

title: Fulco
text: Fulco was the first known missionary Bishop of Estonia.

title: Fulco
text: He was appointed in 1165 by Eskil, the Danish Archbishop of Lund.

title: Fulco
text: Before his appointment, Fulco was a Benedictine monk in the abbey of Moutier- la- Celle, near Troyes in France.

title: Fulco
text: His nationality is not known.

title: Fulco
text: After his appointment, Fulco appears in sources only once.

title: Fulco
text: In 1171, Pope Alexander III asked the Archbishop of Trondheim to assign an Estonian monk Nicolaus living in Stavanger to go to Fulco's assistance.

title: Fulco
text: No further information survives about Fulco's work in Estonia, or whether he ever even got there.

title: Rumbold of Mechelen
text: Saint Rumbold( or" RumoldRomuold") was an Irish or Scottish Christian missionary, although his true nationality is not known for certain.

title: Rumbold of Mechelen
text: He was martyred near Mechelen by two men, whom he had denounced for their evil ways.

title: Rumbold of Mechelen
text: Saint Rumbold's feast day is celebrated by the Roman Catholic Church, and Western Rite Orthodox Churches, on 24 June; and it is celebrated in Ireland on 3 July.

title: Rumbold of Mechelen
text: He is the patron saint of Mechelen, where St. Rumbold's Cathedral possesses an elaborate golden shrine on its high altar, containing relics attributed to the saint.

title: Rumbold of Mechelen
text: It is rumoured that his remains are buried inside the cathedral.

title: Rumbold of Mechelen
text: Twenty- five paintings in the choir illustrate his life.

title: Khalid al-Habib
text: Khalid al- Habib also believed to use the nom de guerre Khalid al Harbi is an Al- Qaeda leader who has overseen Al- Qaeda operations in Afghanistan.

title: Khalid al-Habib
text: In 2005 it was reported that al- Habib died in a US missile strike on the Pakistani village of Damadola though it is unclear whether this is the case as Pakistani officials have claimed that no Al- Qaeda leaders died in the attack.

title: Khalid al-Habib
text: al- Habib's nationality is not clear with sources claiming he may be Egyptian or Moroccan.

title: Roberto Savio
text: Roberto Savio( born in Rome, Italy, but also holding Argentine nationality) is a journalist, communication expert, political commentator, activist for social and climate justice and advocate of global governance.

title: Roberto Savio
text: He has spent most of his career with Inter Press Service( IPS), the news agency which he founded in 1964 along with Argentine journalist Pablo Piacentini.

title: Roberto Savio
text: Savio studied Economics at the University of Parma, followed by post -graduate courses in Development Economics under Gunnar Myrdal, History of Art and International Law in Rome.

title: Roberto Savio
text: He started his professional career as a research assistant in International Law at the University of Parma.

title: Aleksandra Marianna Wiesiołowska
text: Aleksandra Marianna Wiesiołowska (died on 14 August 1645) was the daughter of magnate Marek Sobieski and Jadwiga Snopkowska.

title: Aleksandra Marianna Wiesiołowska
text: She was married to Court Marshal of Lithuania Krzysztof Wiesiołowski.

title: Marek Sobieski
text: Marek Sobieski (

title: Marek Sobieski
text: 1549/1550 – 1605) was a Polish–Lithuanian noble (szlachcic).

title: Marek Sobieski
text: He was a courtier from 1577, a Royal Court Chorąży (chorąży nadworny królewski) from 1581, a castellan of Lublin from 1597, and a voivode of Lublin Voivodeship from c. 1597/98.

title: Marek Sobieski
text: He was the grandfather of Jan III Sobieski, the elected King of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth.

title: Ali Rahuma
text: Ali Khalifa Rahuma( born May 16, 1982) is a Libyan football midfielder who's nationality is Libyan.

title: Ali Rahuma
text: He currently plays for Al- Ittihad, and is a member of the Libya national football team.

title: Eleni Gabre-Madhin
text: Eleni Zaude Gabre- Madhin, an Ethiopian economist with Swiss nationality, is a former Chief Executive Officer of the Ethiopia Commodity Exchange( ECX).

title: Eleni Gabre-Madhin
text: She has had many years of experience working on agricultural markets – particularly in Sub- Saharan Africa – and has held senior positions in the World Bank, the International Food Policy Research Institute( Washington), and United Nations( Geneva).

title: Nayelly Hernández
text: Nayelly Hernández( born 23 February 1986) is a former Mexican female professional squash player.

title: Nayelly Hernández
text: She has represented Mexico internationally in several international competitions including the Central American and Caribbean Games, Pan American Games, Women's World Team Squash Championships.

title: Nayelly Hernández
text: Nayelly achieved her highest career ranking of 57 in October 2011 during the 2011 PSA World Tour.

title: Nayelly Hernández
text: Her husband Chris Walker whose nationality is English is also a professional squash player.

title: Nayelly Hernández
text: She joined the Trinity College in 2008 as the first Mexican female to join a US college for squash and graduated in 2010.

title: Baglan Mailybayev
text: Baglan Mailybayev( in Kazakh Бағлан Асаубайұлы Майлыбаев) was born on 20 May 1975 in Zhambyl region, Kazakhstan.

title: Baglan Mailybayev
text: His nationality is Kazakh.

title: Baglan Mailybayev
text: He is a politician of the Republic of Kazakhstan, Deputy Head of the Presidential Administration of the Republic of Kazakhstan, Doctor of Law( 2002)( under the supervision of Professor Zimanov S.Z.- scientific advisor and academician of National Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Kazakhstan) and Ph.D. in Political Science( 1998).

title: Fulco
text: Fulco was the first known missionary Bishop of Estonia.

title: Fulco
text: He was appointed in 1165 by Eskil, the Danish Archbishop of Lund.

title: Fulco
text: Before his appointment, Fulco was a Benedictine monk in the abbey of Moutier- la- Celle, near Troyes in France.

title: Fulco
text: His nationality is not known.

title: Fulco
text: After his appointment, Fulco appears in sources only once.

title: Fulco
text: In 1171, Pope Alexander III asked the Archbishop of Trondheim to assign an Estonian monk Nicolaus living in Stavanger to go to Fulco's assistance.

title: Fulco
text: No further information survives about Fulco's work in Estonia, or whether he ever even got there.

title: Tivala
text: Tivala (born 3rd-century BC), also referred to as Tivara, was a son of Maurya Emperor Ashoka from his second queen, Karuvaki.

title: Tivala
text: He is the only son of Ashoka who is mentioned by name in his inscriptions, along with his mother, in the Queen Edict.

title: Tivala
text: He was the favourite child of his father and probably the crown prince , being his mother the only wife of Ashoka living in the palace advising him on his matters.

title: Tivala
text: Tivala is the only son of Ashoka whose existence is attested by historical evidence and who was a possible successor to his father.

title: Tivala
text: However, it seems that Tivala may have predeceased Ashoka and thus could not succeed him as Emperor.

title: Tivala
text: Tivala is also considered to have been a favourite child of his aging father.

title: Ashoka
text: Ashoka (Brāhmi: 𑀅𑀲𑁄𑀓, "Asoka", IAST: Aśoka)

title: Ashoka
text: sometimes Ashoka the Great, was an Indian emperor of the Maurya Dynasty, who ruled almost all of the Indian subcontinent from to 232 BCE.

title: Ashoka
text: The grandson of the founder of the Maurya Dynasty, Chandragupta Maurya, Ashoka promoted the spread of Buddhism across ancient Asia.

title: Ashoka
text: Considered by many to be one of India's greatest emperors, Ashoka expanded Chandragupta's empire to reign over a realm stretching from present-day Afghanistan in the west to Bangladesh in the east.

title: Ashoka
text: It covered the entire Indian subcontinent except for parts of present-day Tamil Nadu, Karnataka and Kerala.

title: Ashoka
text: The empire's capital was Pataliputra (in Magadha, present-day Patna), with provincial capitals at Taxila and Ujjain.

title: Ashoka
text: Ashoka waged a destructive war against the state of Kalinga (modern Odisha), which he conquered in about 260 BCE.

title: Ashoka
text: In about 263 BCE, he converted to Buddhism after witnessing the mass deaths of the Kalinga War, which he had waged out of a desire for conquest and which reportedly directly resulted in more than 100,000 deaths and 150,000 deportations.

title: Ashoka
text: He is remembered for the Ashoka pillars and edicts, for sending Buddhist monks to Sri Lanka and Central Asia, and for establishing monuments marking several significant sites in the life of Gautama Buddha.

title: Ashoka
text: Beyond the Edicts of Ashoka, biographical information about him relies on legends written centuries later, such as the 2nd-century CE "Ashokavadana"Narrative of Ashoka, a part of the "Divyavadana"), and in the Sri Lankan text "Mahavamsa"Great Chronicle).

title: Ashoka
text: The emblem of the modern Republic of India is an adaptation of the Lion Capital of Ashoka.

title: Ashoka
text: His Sanskrit name means "painless, without sorrow" (the "a" privativum and "śokapain, distress").

title: Ashoka
text: In his edicts, he is referred to as ' (Pali ' or "the Beloved of the Gods"), and ' (Pali ' or "He who regards everyone with affection").

title: Ashoka
text: His fondness for his name's connection to the "Saraca asoca" tree, or "Ashoka tree", is also referenced in the "Ashokavadana".

title: Ashoka
text: In "The Outline of History" (1920),

title: Ashoka
text: H.G. Wells wrote, "Amidst the tens of thousands of names of monarchs that crowd the columns of history, their majesties and graciousnesses and serenities and royal highnesses and the like, the name of Ashoka shines, and shines, almost alone, a star."

title: Baglan Mailybayev
text: Baglan Mailybayev( in Kazakh Бағлан Асаубайұлы Майлыбаев) was born on 20 May 1975 in Zhambyl region, Kazakhstan.

title: Baglan Mailybayev
text: His nationality is Kazakh.

title: Baglan Mailybayev
text: He is a politician of the Republic of Kazakhstan, Deputy Head of the Presidential Administration of the Republic of Kazakhstan, Doctor of Law( 2002)( under the supervision of Professor Zimanov S.Z.- scientific advisor and academician of National Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Kazakhstan) and Ph.D. in Political Science( 1998).

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Shu Yu of Tang, surname( 姓): Ji( 姬) given name( 名): Yu( 虞), and Ziyu( 子於), was the founder of the State of Tang during the early Zhou Dynasty( 1046 – 771 BC) of ancient China.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: The State of Tang would later be renamed Jin by Shu Yu's son and successor, Xie.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: He was the son of King Wu of Zhou and the younger brother of King Cheng of Zhou.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Shortly after the establishment of the Zhou Dynasty, King Wu of Zhou died.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: His son, Prince Song, ascended the throne and became King Cheng of Zhou.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Since he was very young and too inexperienced to run the newly founded dynasty, his uncle, the Duke of Zhou, served as regent and handled all political affairs until King Cheng of Zhou became old enough to rule.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: In the year that King Cheng of Zhou ascended the throne, the people of a land called Tang( 唐) rebelled, so the Duke of Zhou conquered them.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: According to the Records of the Grand Historian, one day, King Cheng of Zhou was playing with his younger brother, Prince Yu. King Cheng of Zhou suddenly picked up a parasol tree leaf and gave it to Prince Yu.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Then he said playfully," Let this be a proof that I will make you a feudal lord."

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Prince

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Yu happily got the leaf and he then told this to the Duke of Zhou.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: The Duke of Zhou thought that whatever the young King Cheng of Zhou said should not be taken lightly since he was the king.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: The Duke of Zhou approached the young king and asked him if it were true.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: The young king said that he was just joking with his brother.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Then the Duke of Zhou replied," A sovereign must not joke about the things he says and do as what he has said."

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: The young king thought it was reasonable and gave the recent conquered called Tang land, west of modern Yicheng County in Shanxi, to his brother, Prince Yu. Shu Yu's son and successor, Xie, moved the capital Jiang( 绛) nearer to the Jin River and renamed the state Jin.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: Jinci was a shrine in Taiyuan dedicated to Shu Yu.

title: Shu Yu of Tang
text: It is a major historical and cultural site protected at the national level in People's republic of China.

title: King Kang of Zhou
text: King Kang of Zhou or King K’ang of Chou was the third sovereign of the Chinese Zhou Dynasty and son of the King Cheng of Zhou.

title: King Kang of Zhou
text: The dates of his reign are 1020-996 BC or 1005–978 BC.

title: King Kang of Zhou
text: King Kang followed his father King Cheng’s policy and expanded the Zhou territory in the North and in the West.

title: King Kang of Zhou
text: He also repressed a rebellion in the east.

title: King Kang of Zhou
text: Life prospered in the Zhou Dynasty under Kang’s rule.

title: King Kang of Zhou
text: His was succeeded by his son King Zhao of Zhou.

title: Duke Ding of Qi
text: Duke Ding of Qi (reigned c. 10th century BC) was the second recorded ruler of the ancient Chinese state of Qi during the Western Zhou Dynasty.

title: Duke Ding of Qi
text: His personal name was Lü Ji (呂伋) and

title: Duke Ding of Qi
text: ancestral name was Jiang (姜).

title: Duke Ding of Qi
text: According to classical Chinese texts such as the "Records of the Grand Historian" and "Zuo Zhuan", Duke Ding succeeded his father Lü Shang, Duke Tai of Qi, who was said to have been a centenarian.

title: Duke Ding of Qi
text: Duke Ding supposedly served King Kang of Zhou along with other major vassal state rulers including Xiong Yi, viscount of Chu, Count Kang of Wey (衞康伯), Xie, Marquis of Jin and Boqin, Duke of Lu.

title: Duke Ding of Qi
text: However, most modern historians believe Duke Ding was in fact the fifth-generation descendant of Duke Tai, and he could not have served King Kang of Zhou.

title: Duke Ding of Qi
text: After Duke Ding died, he was succeeded by his son Duke Yǐ of Qi.

title: King Cheng of Zhou
text: King Cheng of Zhou or King Ch'eng of Chou was the second king of the Chinese Zhou Dynasty.

title: King Cheng of Zhou
text: The dates of his reign are 1042-1021 BCE or 1042/35-1006 BCE.

title: King Cheng of Zhou
text: His parents were King Wu of Zhou and Queen Yi Jiang (邑姜).

title: King Cheng of Zhou
text: King Cheng was young when he ascended the throne.

title: King Cheng of Zhou
text: His uncle, Duke of Zhou, fearing that Shang forces might rise again under the possible weak rule of a young ruler, became the regent and supervised government affairs for several years.

title: King Cheng of Zhou
text: Duke of Zhou established the eastern capital at Luoyang, and later defeated a rebellion by Cheng

title: King Cheng of Zhou
text: ’s

title: King Cheng of Zhou
text: uncles Cai Shu, Guan Shu and Huo Shu.

title: King Cheng of Zhou
text: King Cheng later stabilized Zhou Dynasty’s border by defeating several barbarian tribes along with the Duke of Zhou.

title: King An of Zhou
text: King An of Zhou was the thirty- third king of the Chinese Zhou Dynasty and the twenty first of Eastern Zhou.

title: King An of Zhou
text: He succeeded his father King Weilie of Zhou on the throne of China in 401 BC.

title: King An of Zhou
text: After he died, his son King Lie of Zhou ruled over China.

title: King An of Zhou
text: His other son was King Xian of Zhou.

title: King Ding of Zhou
text: King Ding of Zhou, or King Ting of Chou, was the twenty- first king of the Chinese Zhou Dynasty and the ninth of Eastern Zhou.

title: King Ding of Zhou
text: He was a son of King Qing of Zhou and brother of King Kuang of Zhou.

title: King Ding of Zhou
text: He sent an official named Wangsun Man to present gifts to the Chu army.

title: King Ding of Zhou
text: He met Prince Zhuang.

title: King Kang of Chu
text: King Kang of Chu( died 545 BC) was from 559 to 545 BC the king of Chu, a major power during the Spring and Autumn period of ancient China.

title: King Kang of Chu
text: Born Xiong Zhao, he succeeded his father King Gong of Chu.

title: King Kang of Chu
text: His reign was marked by constant wars with Jin, Chu's traditional enemy, and Wu, its new enemy.

title: King Kang of Chu
text: He ruled for 15 years and was succeeded by his son, Jia'ao, who would four years later be murdered by King Kang's younger brother King Ling of Chu.

title: Duke of Shao
text: Shi, Duke Kang of Shao( died 1000 BC), or Ji Shi, also known as the Earl of Shao, was a high- ranking minister of the early Zhou dynasty.

title: Duke of Shao
text: He was a younger brother of King Wu, the founding king of Zhou.

title: Duke of Shao
text: Siding with his half- brother Duke of Zhou, Duke of Shao helped suppress the Rebellion of the Three Guards after King Wu's death.

title: Duke of Shao
text: During the reigns of King Wu's son King Cheng and King Cheng's son King Kang, Duke of Shao held the post of Grand Protector( 太保), one of the Three Ducal Ministers.

title: Tjuyu
text: Tjuyu( sometimes transliterated as Thuya or Thuyu) was an Egyptian noblewoman and the mother of queen Tiye, and the wife of Yuya.

title: Tjuyu
text: She is the grandmother of Akhenaten, and great grandmother of Tutankhamun.

title: Hubba bint Hulail
text: Hubba bint Hulail was the grandmother of Hashim ibn' Abd Manaf, thus the great- great- great- grandmother of the Islamic" Nabī"( Prophet) Muhammad ibn Abdullah.

title: The Face of Fu Manchu
text: The Face of Fu Manchu is a 1965 thriller film directed by Don Sharp and based on the characters created by Sax Rohmer.

title: The Face of Fu Manchu
text: It stars Christopher Lee as the eponymous villain, a Chinese criminal mastermind, and Nigel Green as his pursuing rival Nayland Smith, a Scotland Yard detective.

title: The Face of Fu Manchu
text: The film was a British- West German co-production, and was the first in a five- part series starring Lee and produced by Harry Alan Towers for Constantin Film, the second of which was" The Brides of Fu Manchu" released the next year, with the final entry being" The Castle of Fu Manchu" in 1969.

title: The Face of Fu Manchu
text: It was shot in Technicolor and Techniscope, on- location in County Dublin, Ireland.

title: The Blood of Fu Manchu
text: The Blood of Fu Manchu, also known as Fu Manchu and the Kiss of Death, Kiss of Death, Kiss and Kill( U.S. title) and Against All Odds( original U.S. video title), is a 1968 British adventure crime film directed by Jesús Franco, based on the fictional Asian villain Dr. Fu Manchu created by Sax Rohmer.

title: The Blood of Fu Manchu
text: It was the fourth film in a series, and was preceded by" The Vengeance of Fu Manchu The Castle of Fu Manchu" followed in 1969.

title: The Blood of Fu Manchu
text: It was produced by Harry Alan Towers for Udastex Films.

title: The Blood of Fu Manchu
text: It starred Christopher Lee as Dr. Fu Manchu, Richard Greene as Scotland Yard detective Nayland Smith, and Howard Marion- Crawford as Dr. Petrie.

title: The Blood of Fu Manchu
text: The movie was filmed in Spain and Brazil.

title: The Blood of Fu Manchu
text: Shirley Eaton appears in a scene that she claimed she was never paid for; apparently, the director Jesús Franco had inserted some stock footage of her from one of her films(" The Girl from Rio"( 1968)) into the film without telling her.

title: The Blood of Fu Manchu
text: She only found out years later that she had been in a Fu Manchu film.

title: Don Sharp
text: Donald Herman Sharp( 19 April 192114 December 2011) was an Australian- born British film director.

title: Don Sharp
text: His best known films were made for Hammer in the 1960s, and included" The Kiss of the Vampire"( 1962) and" Rasputin, the Mad Monk"( 1966).

title: Don Sharp
text: In 1965 he directed" The Face of Fu Manchu", based on the character created by Sax Rohmer, and starring Christopher Lee.

title: Don Sharp
text: Sharp also directed the sequel" The Brides of Fu Manchu"( 1966).

title: Don Sharp
text: In the 1980s he was also responsible for several hugely popular miniseries adapted from the novels of Barbara Taylor Bradford.

title: The Brides of Fu Manchu
text: The Brides of Fu Manchu is a 1966 British/ West German Constantin Film co-production adventure crime film based on the fictional Chinese villain Dr. Fu Manchu, created by Sax Rohmer.

title: The Brides of Fu Manchu
text: It was the second film in a series, and was preceded by" The Face of Fu ManchuThe Vengeance of Fu Manchu" followed in 1967," The Blood of Fu Manchu" in 1968, and" The Castle of Fu Manchu" in 1969.

title: The Brides of Fu Manchu
text: It was produced by Harry Alan Towers for Hallam Productions.

title: The Brides of Fu Manchu
text: Like the first film, it was directed by Don Sharp, and starred Christopher Lee as Fu Manchu.

title: The Brides of Fu Manchu
text: Nigel Green was replaced by Douglas Wilmer as Scotland Yard detective Nayland Smith.

title: The Brides of Fu Manchu
text: The action takes place mainly in London, where much of the location filming took place.

title: Roberto Gavaldón
text: Roberto Gavaldón( June 7, 1909 in Jiménez, Chihuahua – September 4, 1986 in Mexico City) was a Mexican film director.

title: Roberto Gavaldón
text: Eight of Gavaldón's films were featured on the list 100 Best Movies of the Cinema of Mexico.

title: Roberto Gavaldón
text: His 1958 film" Ash Wednesday" was entered into the 8th Berlin International Film Festival and his 1959 film" Beyond All Limits" was entered into the following years festival.

title: Roberto Gavaldón
text: His 1960 film" Macario" was entered into the 1960 Cannes Film Festival and was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film.

title: The Hidden One
text: The Hidden One is a 1956 Mexican drama film directed by Roberto Gavaldón.

title: The Hidden One
text: It was entered into the 1956 Cannes Film Festival.

title: Glen Gordon
text: Glen Charles Gordon( March 13, 1914 September 16, 1977) was an American actor.

title: Glen Gordon
text: Among other roles, Gordon played the role of Fu Manchu in the 1956 television series" The Adventures of Dr. Fu Manchu".

title: The Castle of Fu Manchu
text: The Castle of Fu Manchu( also known as The Torture Chamber of Dr. Fu Manchu and also known by its German title Die Folterkammer des Dr. Fu Man Chu) is a 1969 film and the fifth and final Dr. Fu Manchu film with Christopher Lee portraying the title character.

title: The Mask of Fu Manchu
text: The Mask of Fu Manchu is a 1932 pre-Code adventure film directed by Charles Brabin.

title: The Mask of Fu Manchu
text: It was written by Irene Kuhn, Edgar Allan Woolf and John Willard based on the 1932 novel of the same name by Sax Rohmer.

title: The Mask of Fu Manchu
text: Starring Boris Karloff as Fu Manchu, and featuring Myrna Loy as his depraved daughter, the movie revolves around Fu Manchu's quest for the golden sword and mask of Genghis Khan.

title: The Mask of Fu Manchu
text: Lewis Stone plays his nemesis.

title: The Mask of Fu Manchu
text: Dr. Petrie is absent from this film.

title: Fu Xuan
text: Fu Xuan( 217–278), courtesy name Xiuyi, was a Chinese historian, poet, and politician who lived in the state of Cao Wei during the Three Kingdoms period and later under the Jin dynasty.

title: Fu Xuan
text: He was one of the most prolific authors of" fu" poetry of his time.

title: Fu Xuan
text: He was a grandson of Fu Xie( 傅燮), a son of Fu Gan( 傅幹), and the father of Fu Xian( 傅咸).

title: Jesse E. Hobson
text: Jesse Edward Hobson( May 2, 1911 – November 5, 1970) was the director of SRI International from 1947 to 1955.

title: Jesse E. Hobson
text: Prior to SRI, he was the director of the Armour Research Foundation.

title: Peter Levin
text: Peter Levin is an American director of film, television and theatre.

title: Mark Durden-Smith
text: Mark Durden- Smith( born 1 October 1968 in Soho, London) is an English television presenter best known for presenting ITV shows such as and" This Morning Summer", Sky 1 shows such as" The Match" and" Double or Nothing", and Channel 5's rugby union coverage.

title: Ian Barry (director)
text: Ian Barry is an Australian director of film and TV.

title: Olav Aaraas
text: Olav Aaraas( born 10 July 1950) is a Norwegian historian and museum director.

title: Olav Aaraas
text: He was born in Fredrikstad.

title: Olav Aaraas
text: From 1982 to 1993 he was the director of Sogn Folk Museum, from 1993 to 2010 he was the director of Maihaugen and from 2001 he has been the director of the Norwegian Museum of Cultural History.

title: Olav Aaraas
text: In 2010 he was decorated with the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav.

title: Totò lascia o raddoppia?
text: Totò lascia o raddoppia?

title: Totò lascia o raddoppia?
text: ( Totò double or nothing?) is a 1956 Italian comedy film directed by Camillo Mastrocinque.

title: Double or Nothing (1940 film)
text: Double or Nothing (1940) is a short comedy film released by Warner Brothers, directed by Roy Mack, and starring Lee Dixon along with the real-life "doubles" of famous Hollywood actors.

title: Double or Nothing (1940 film)
text: Actor Tom Herbert appears as the double for his brother, comedian Hugh Herbert.

title: Brian Kennedy (gallery director)
text: Brian Patrick Kennedy( born 5 November 1961) is an Irish- born art museum director who has worked in Ireland and Australia, and now lives and works in the United States.

title: Brian Kennedy (gallery director)
text: He is currently the director of the Peabody Essex Museum.

title: Brian Kennedy (gallery director)

title: Robert Florey

title: Robert Florey

title: Robert Florey

title: Robert Florey

title: Right to know
text: " Right to know", in the context of United States workplace and community environmental law, is the legal principle that the individual has the right to know the chemicals to which they may be exposed in their daily living.

title: Right to know
text: It is embodied in federal law in the United States as well as in local laws in several states.

title: Right to know
text: " Right to Know" laws take two forms: Community Right to Know and Workplace Right to Know.

title: Right to know
text: Each grants certain rights to those groups.

title: Right to know
text: The" right to know" concept is included in Rachel Carson's book" Silent Spring".

title: Right to know
text: Environmental illness shares characteristics with common diseases.

title: Right to know
text: For example, cyanide exposure symptoms include weakness, headache, nausea, confusion, dizziness, seizures, cardiac arrest, and unconsciousness.

title: Right to know
text: Influenza and heart disease include the same symptoms.

title: Right to know
text: Cyanide is one of the most toxic known substances, and failure to obtain proper disclosure is likely to lead to improper or ineffective medical diagnosis and treatment.

title: Right to know
text: This can contribute to prolonged illness and death.

title: Ręce do góry
text: Ręce do góry (known in its subtitled English version as Hands Up!) is a Polish drama film directed by Jerzy Skolimowski.

title: Ręce do góry
text: It is the fourth of a series of semi-autobiographical films in which Skolimowski himself plays his "alter ego", Andrzej Leszczyc.

title: Ręce do góry
text: At the time it was banned in Poland, under the Communist regime, for 18 years because it depicted the Stalinist past.

title: Ręce do góry
text: The film was originally made in 1967 in monochrome by studio.

title: Ręce do góry
text: In a twenty-minute section (filmed in colour) added by Skolimowski in 1981 he explains how the original was withheld by Polish censors of the time, and that this was a principal cause of

title: Ręce do góry
text: his leaving his country; however following liberalisation in Poland, he was invited to resuscitate it.

title: Ręce do góry
text: The introduction includes, apart from some fictional apocalyptic passages, shots of Beirut ruined by the civil wars of the 1970s, where Skolimowski is working as an actor on Volker Schloendorff's German film "Die Fälschung (Circle of Deceit)", and also shots of London featuring demonstrations in favour of "Solidarnosc", Speaker's Corner, and an exhibition of Skolimowski's own paintings.

title: Ręce do góry
text: These sections include cameo roles by Bruno Ganz, David Essex, Mike Sarne and others.

title: Ręce do góry
text: Some of the music in this introduction is from the 1970 choral work "Kosmogonia" by the Polish composer Krzysztof Penderecki.

title: Ręce do góry
text: The original film is a surrealistic reunion of Leszczyc (who has apparently become a veterinary surgeon) and some of his student colleagues.

title: Ręce do góry
text: They refer to themselves by the makes of the cars they own

title: Ręce do góry
text: - Leszczyc owns a Zastawa, one owns a Wartburg, the others own more upmarket models such as an Opel Rekord or the Alfa Romeo owned by the unhappily married couple.

title: Ręce do góry
text: Supposedly taking speed (although it is later revealed the pills are a placebo), and carousing in the cattle truck of a freight train, the group offers various satirical sidelights on Polish society of the 1960s.

title: Ręce do góry
text: The characters also reflect that the truck may have been one of those in which the former generation were transported during World War II to the Nazi death camps.

title: Ręce do góry
text: The final credits show the actors as they are in 1981, with the exception of Bogumil Kobiela, who died in 1969.

title: Ręce do góry
text: The film was screened out of competition at the 1981 Cannes Film Festival.

title: Vivien Leigh
text: Vivien Leigh , born Vivian Mary Hartley and styled as Lady Olivier after 1947 (5 November 1913 – 8 July 1967) was a British stage and film actress.

title: Vivien Leigh
text: She won two Academy Awards for Best Actress, for her definitive performances as Scarlett O'Hara in "Gone with the Wind" (1939) and Blanche DuBois in the film version of "A Streetcar

title: Vivien Leigh
text: Named Desire" (1951), a role she had also played on stage in London's West End in 1949.

title: Vivien Leigh
text: She also won a Tony Award for her work in the Broadway musical version of "Tovarich" (1963).

title: Vivien Leigh
text: After completing her drama school education, Leigh appeared in small roles in four films in 1935 and progressed to the role of heroine in "Fire Over England" (1937).

title: Vivien Leigh
text: Lauded for her beauty, Leigh felt that her physical attributes sometimes prevented her from being taken seriously as an actress.

title: Vivien Leigh
text: Despite her fame as a screen actress, Leigh was primarily a stage performer.

title: Vivien Leigh
text: During her 30-year career, she played roles ranging from the heroines of Noël Coward and George Bernard Shaw comedies to classic Shakespearean characters such as Ophelia, Cleopatra, Juliet, and Lady Macbeth.

title: Vivien Leigh
text: Later in life, she performed as a character actress in a few films.

title: Vivien Leigh
text: At the time, the public strongly identified Leigh with her second husband, Laurence Olivier, who was her spouse from 1940 to 1960.

title: Vivien Leigh
text: Leigh and Olivier starred together in many stage productions, with Olivier often directing, and in three films.

title: Vivien Leigh
text: She earned a reputation for being difficult to work with, and for much of her adult life, she suffered from bipolar disorder, as well as recurrent bouts of chronic tuberculosis, which was first diagnosed in the mid-1940s and ultimately claimed her life at the age of 53.

title: Vivien Leigh
text: Although her career had periods of inactivity, in 1999 the American Film Institute ranked Leigh as the 16th greatest female movie star of classic Hollywood cinema.

title: Sennedjem
text: The Ancient Egyptian artisan Sennedjem lived in Set Maat( translated as" The Place of Truth"), contemporary Deir el- Medina, on the west bank of the Nile, opposite Thebes, during the reigns of Seti I and Ramesses II.

title: Sennedjem
text: Sennedjem had the title" Servant in the Place of Truth".

title: Sennedjem
text: He was buried along with his wife, Iyneferti, and family in a tomb in the village necropolis.

title: Sennedjem
text: His tomb was discovered January 31, 1886.

title: Sennedjem
text: When Sennedjem's tomb was found, in it there was regular furniture from his home, including a stool and a bed, which he actually used when he was alive.

title: Sennedjem
text: His titles included Servant in the Place of Truth, meaning that he worked on the excavation and decoration of the nearby royal tombs.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth( POB) or birthplace is the place where a person was born.

title: Place of birth
text: This place is often used in legal documents, together with name and date of birth, to uniquely identify a person.

title: Place of birth
text: As a general rule with respect to passports, the place of birth is determined to be the country that currently has" sovereignty" over the actual place of birth, regardless of when the birth actually occurred.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth is not necessarily the place where the parents of the new baby live.

title: Place of birth
text: If the baby is born in a hospital in another place, that place is the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In many countries, this also means that the government requires that the birth of the new baby is registered in the place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: Some countries place less or no importance on the place of birth, instead using alternative geographical characteristics for the purpose of identity documents.

title: Place of birth
text: For example, Sweden has used the concept of" födelsehemortdomicile of birth") since 1947.

title: Place of birth
text: This means that the domicile of the baby's mother is the registered place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: The location of the maternity ward or other physical birthplace is considered unimportant.

title: Place of birth
text: Similarly, Switzerland uses the concept of" Heimatortlieu d'origineluogo d'origineplace of origin" in German, French and Italian respectively).

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to Swiss parents is automatically assigned the place of origin of the parent with the same last name, so the child either gets their mother's or father's place of origin.

title: Place of birth
text: A child born to one Swiss parent and one foreign parent acquires the place of origin of their Swiss parent.

title: Place of birth
text: In a Swiss passport and identity card, the holder's place of origin is stated, not their place of birth.

title: Place of birth
text: In some countries( primarily in the Americas), the place of birth automatically determines the nationality of the baby, a practice often referred to by the Latin phrase" jus soli".

title: Place of birth
text: Almost all countries outside the Americas instead attribute nationality based on the nationality( ies) of the baby's parents( referred to as" jus sanguinis").

title: Place of birth
text: There can be some confusion regarding the place of birth if the birth takes place in an unusual way: when babies are born on an airplane or at sea, difficulties can arise.

title: Place of birth
text: The place of birth of such a person depends on the law of the countries involved, which include the nationality of the plane or ship, the nationality( ies) of the parents and/ or the location of the plane or ship( if the birth occurs in the territorial waters or airspace of a country).

title: Place of birth
text: Some administrative forms may request the applicant's" country of birth".

title: Place of birth
text: It is important to determine from the requester whether the information requested refers to the applicant's" place of birth" or" nationality at birth".

title: Place of birth
text: For US citizens born abroad who under the US Constitution acquire US citizenship at the time of birth, the nationality at birth will be USA( American), while the place of birth would be the country in which the actual birth takes place.

title: American Sniper
text: American Sniper is a 2014 American biographical war drama film directed by Clint Eastwood and written by Jason Hall.

title: American Sniper
text: It is loosely based on the memoir" American Sniper: The Autobiography of the Most Lethal Sniper in U.S. Military History"( 2012) by Chris Kyle, with Scott McEwen and Jim DeFelice.

title: American Sniper
text: The film follows the life of Kyle, who became the deadliest marksman in U.S. military history with 255 kills from four tours in the Iraq War, 160 of which were officially confirmed by the Department of Defense.

title: American Sniper
text: While Kyle was celebrated for his military successes, his tours of duty took a heavy toll on his personal and family life.

title: American Sniper
text: The film was produced by Eastwood, Robert Lorenz, Andrew Lazar, Bradley Cooper, and Peter Morgan.

title: American Sniper
text: It stars Cooper as Kyle and Sienna Miller as his wife Taya, with Luke Grimes, Jake McDorman, Cory Hardrict, Kevin Lacz, Navid Negahban, and Keir O'Donnell in supporting roles.

title: American Sniper
text: The world premiere was on November 11, 2014, at the American Film Institute Festival, followed by a limited theatrical release in the United States on December 25, 2014, and a wide release on January 16, 2015.

title: American Sniper
text: The film became a major success, with a worldwide gross of over$ 547 million, making it the highest- grossing film of 2014 in the United States($ 350 million), the highest- grossing war film of all time unadjusted for inflation, and Eastwood's highest- grossing film to date.

title: American Sniper
text: The film received mostly positive reviews, with praise for towards Cooper's lead performance and Eastwood's direction, although it attracted some controversy over its portrayal of both the War in Iraq and Chris Kyle.

title: American Sniper
text: At the 87th Academy Awards," American Sniper" received six nominations, including Best Picture, Best Adapted Screenplay, and Best Actor for Cooper, ultimately winning one award for Best Sound Editing.

title: Clint Eastwood
text: Clinton Eastwood Jr.( born May 31, 1930) is an American actor, filmmaker, musician, and politician.

title: Clint Eastwood
text: After achieving success in the Western TV series" Rawhide", he rose to international fame with his role as the Man with No Name in Italian filmmaker Sergio Leone's" Dollars" Trilogy of spaghetti Westerns during the 1960s and as antihero cop Harry Callahan in the five" Dirty Harry" films throughout the 1970s and 1980s.

title: Clint Eastwood
text: These roles, among others, have made Eastwood an enduring cultural icon of masculinity.

title: Clint Eastwood
text: For his work in the Western film" Unforgiven"( 1992) and the sports drama" Million Dollar Baby"( 2004), Eastwood won Academy Awards for Best Director and Best Picture, as well as receiving nominations for Best Actor.

title: Clint Eastwood
text: Eastwood's greatest commercial successes have been the adventure comedy" Every Which Way But Loose"( 1978) and it s sequel, the action comedy" Any Which Way You Can"( 1980), after adjustment for inflation.

title: Clint Eastwood
text: Other popular films include the Western" Hang' Em High"( 1968), the psychological thriller" Play Misty for Me"( 1971), the crime film" Thunderbolt and Lightfoot"( 1974), the Western" The Outlaw Josey Wales"( 1976), the prison film" Escape from Alcatraz"( 1979), the action film" Firefox"( 1982), the suspense thriller" Tightrope"( 1984), the Western" Pale Rider"( 1985), the war films" Where Eagles Dare"( 1968)," Kelly's Heroes"( 1970), and" Heartbreak Ridge"( 1986), the action thriller" In the Line of Fire"( 1993), the romantic drama" The Bridges of Madison County"( 1995), and the drama" Gran Torino"( 2008).

title: Clint Eastwood
text: In addition to directing many of his own star vehicles, Eastwood has also directed films in which he did not appear, such as the mystery drama" Mystic River"( 2003) and the war film" Letters from Iwo Jima"( 2006), for which he received Academy Award nominations, the drama" Changeling"( 2008), and the South African biographical political sports drama" Invictus"( 2009).

title: Clint Eastwood
text: The war drama biopic" American Sniper"( 2014) set box- office records for the largest January release ever and was also the largest opening ever for an Eastwood film.

title: Clint Eastwood
text: Eastwood received considerable critical praise in France for several films, including some that were not well received in the United States.

title: Clint Eastwood
text: Eastwood has been awarded two of France's highest honors: in 1994, he became a recipient of the Commander of the Ordre des Arts et des Lettres, and in 2007, he was awarded the Legion of Honour medal.

title: Clint Eastwood
text: In 2000, Eastwood was awarded the Italian Venice Film Festival Golden Lion for lifetime achievement.

title: Clint Eastwood
text: Since 1967, Eastwood's Malpaso Productions has produced all but four of his American films.

title: Clint Eastwood
text: Elected in 1986, Eastwood served for two years as mayor of Carmel- by- the- Sea, California, a non-partisan office.

title: Befikre
text: Befikre is a 2016 Indian Hindi- language romantic comedy- drama film written, directed, and produced by Aditya Chopra under his banner of Yash Raj Films.

title: Befikre
text: It features Ranveer Singh and Vaani Kapoor in the lead roles.

title: Befikre
text: The film was shot over a period of 50 days in Paris and Mumbai.

title: Befikre
text: It released worldwide on 9 December 2016 to mixed reviews.

title: Befikre
text: The film's songs has been composed by Vishal- Shekhar and produced by Mikey McCleary with Vishal- Shekhar.

title: Befikre
text: McCleary also composed the background score of the movie.

title: Befikre
text: This is Chopra's only directorial venture without Shah Rukh Khan in the lead role.

title: Peter Morgan (producer)

title: Aditya Chopra
text: Aditya Chopra( born 21 May 1971) is an Indian filmmaker.

title: Aditya Chopra
text: His work as a director includes" Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge"( 1995)," Mohabbatein"( 2000)," Rab Ne Bana Di Jodi"( 2008) and" Befikre"( 2016).

title: Aditya Chopra
text: He is also the current Chairman of India's multi-national film, media and entertainment conglomerate Yash Raj Films( YRF).

title: Aditya Chopra
text: Chopra has written and produced a number of films under the banner such as" Veer- Zaara"( 2004)," Fanaa"( 2006)," Band Baaja Baaraat"( 2010)," Jab Tak Hai Jaan"( 2012), the" Dhoom series"( 2004, 2006& 2013)," Sultan"( 2016), the" Tiger series"( 2012& 2017) and" War"( 2019).

title: Aditya Chopra
text: He has broken away from typecast through production of off- beat films such as" Kabul Express"( 2006)," Chak De! India"( 2007),( 2009)," Dum Laga Ke Haisha"( 2015) and" Hichki!"( 2018), that do not necessarily fit into the realm of" masala films".

title: Aditya Chopra
text: Chopra is also the first to move towards a true film studio model through independent projects helmed by talent under his banner.

title: Aditya Chopra
text: Major post-production work of the company is now carried out of YRF Studios( co- founded by his ex-wife Payal Khanna), where Chopra serves as Chief Executive.

title: Aditya Chopra
text: He has produced ten films that have accumulated worldwide gross earnings of more than 200 crore, which is the most for an Indian film producer.

title: Aditya Chopra
text: In December 2009, Chopra fought a hostile acquisition bid by Walt Disney, valued upwards of 2500 crore, to remain and continue purely as a domestic entity aided by the Tata Sons.

title: Aditya Chopra
text: Apart from emerging as an equitable brand, his company has earned the status of a movie mogul through distribution networks spread across the globe, estimated to be net worth 7640 crore( FY17/18) by the NSE, thereby making it the biggest and most successful film production company in the history of Indian Cinema.

title: Aditya Chopra
text: Having denied him admission into the NSD as a young applicant, the Directorate of Film Festivals eventually honored him with the National Award for his achievements in 1995, 2005, 2007 and 2015.

title: Aditya Chopra
text: The Government of India appealed both Chopra and Mani Ratnam to focus on content created locally under its Make in India initiative, which was later followed by productions like" Daawat- e- Ishq"( 2014)," Meri Pyaari Bindu"( 2016)," Sui- Dhaaga"( 2018) and" Jayeshbhai Jordaar"( 2020) planned by his company.

title: Aditya Chopra
text: In June 2018, he was awarded membership into The Academy by the Producers Guild of America.

title: Aditya Chopra
text: Widely regarded as one of the most influential and powerful executives in Indian entertainment, Chopra has however rejected the publicity and fame that came with being Yash Chopra's son and the Chief Executive of Yash Raj Films.

title: Aditya Chopra
text: He has remained extremely media -shy and a passive individual, battling constant reports of an alleged dysthymic disorder throughout his three- decade career, resulting in very few public photos of him being in existence.

title: Jérôme Bonaparte
text: Jérôme-Napoléon Bonaparte (born Girolamo Buonaparte; 15 November 1784 – 24 June 1860) was the youngest brother of Napoleon I and reigned as Jerome I (formally Hieronymus Napoleon in German), King of Westphalia, between 1807 and 1813.

title: Jérôme Bonaparte
text: From 1816 onward, he bore the title of Prince of Montfort.

title: Jérôme Bonaparte
text: After 1848, when his nephew, Louis Napoleon, became President of the French Second Republic, he served in several official roles, including Marshal of France from 1850 onward, and President of the Senate in 1852.

title: Rachel Félix

title: Rachel Félix
text: She became a prominent figure in French society, and was the mistress of, among others, Napoleon III, Napoléon Joseph Charles Paul Bonaparte and Alexandre Colonna- Walewski, the illegitimate son of Napoleon I. Efforts by newspapers to publish pictures of her on her deathbed led to the introduction of privacy rights into French law.

text: Maria Clotilde of Savoy( Ludovica Teresa Maria Clotilde; 2 March 1843 – 25 June 1911) was born in Turin to Vittorio Emanuele II, later King of Italy and his first wife, Adelaide of Austria.

title: Théobald Chartran
text: Théobald Chartran( 20 July 1849 – 16 July 1907) was a classical French propaganda painter.

title: Théobald Chartran
text: As" T", he was one of the artists responsible for occasional caricatures of" Vanity Fair" magazine, specializing in French and Italian subjects.

title: Théobald Chartran
text: His work for" Vanity Fair" included Pope Leo XIII, Giuseppe Garibaldi, Umberto I of Italy, William Henry Waddington, all in 1878, Charles Gounod, Giuseppe Verdi, Ernest Renan, Jules Grévy, Napoléon Joseph Charles Paul Bonaparte, Victor Hugo, Marshal MacMahon, Granier de Cassagnac, Louis Blanc, and Alexandre Dumas" fils", all in 1879.

title: Théobald Chartran
text: President Theodore Roosevelt's official portrait was originally commissioned to Théobald Chartran in 1902, but when Roosevelt saw the final product he hated it and hid it in the darkest corner of the White House.

title: Théobald Chartran
text: When family members called it the" Mewing Cat" for making him look so harmless, he had it destroyed and hired John Singer Sargent to paint a more masculine portrait.

title: Théobald Chartran
text: Among Chartran's work is his portrait of René- Théophile- Hyacinthe Laennec, the inventor of the stethoscope.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God?" first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is?" illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God?" was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The other current books in the" What is?" series include

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Love?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Death?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Beautiful?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Funny?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Right?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Peace?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Money?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Dreaming?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Friend?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is True?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Family?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Feeling?"

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The series is now also translated into 15 languages.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He has helped numerous other authors to get published through" How to Get Your Book Published!" programs.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer is also a yoga teacher who teaches regular classes locally and guest- teaches nationally.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He is also recognized nationally as an erudite speaker on" The Teachings of the Buddha."

title: Prince Napoléon Bonaparte
text: Napoléon Joseph Charles Paul Bonaparte (9 September 1822 – 17 March 1891), usually called Napoléon-Jérôme Bonaparte or Jérôme Bonaparte, was the second son of Jerome, King of Westphalia and his second wife Catharina of Württemberg.

title: Prince Napoléon Bonaparte
text: An oustpoken liberal, he became the "de facto" head of the House of Bonaparte from 1879 to his death.

title: Prince Napoléon Bonaparte
text: He wasn't considered a legitimate pretender to the throne by many Bonapartists, due to his fathers previous marriage without divorce.

title: Prince Napoléon Bonaparte
text: They instead preferred his son Victor.

title: Prince Napoléon Bonaparte

title: William S. Burroughs
text: William Seward Burroughs II (February 5, 1914 – August 2, 1997) was an American writer and visual artist.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: Burroughs was a primary figure of the Beat Generation and a major postmodernist author whose influence is considered to have affected a range of popular culture as well as literature.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: Burroughs wrote eighteen novels and novellas, six collections of short stories and four collections of essays.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: Five books have been published of his interviews and correspondences.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: He also collaborated on projects and recordings with numerous performers and musicians and made many appearances in films.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: He was also briefly known by the pen name William Lee.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: Burroughs created and exhibited thousands of paintings and other visual artworks, including his celebrated 'Gunshot Paintings'.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: He was born into a wealthy family in St. Louis, Missouri, grandson of the inventor and founder of the Burroughs Corporation, William Seward Burroughs I, and nephew of public relations manager Ivy Lee.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: Burroughs began writing essays and journals in early adolescence but did not begin publicizing his writing until his thirties.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: He left home in 1932 to attend Harvard University, studied English, and anthropology as a postgraduate, and later attended medical school in Vienna.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: In 1942 Burroughs enlisted in the U.S. Army to serve during World War II, but was turned down by the Office of Strategic Services and Navy, after which he picked up the drug addiction that affected him for the rest of his life, while working a variety of jobs.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: In 1943, while living in New York City, he befriended Allen Ginsberg and Jack Kerouac, and out of their mutual influence grew the foundation of the Beat Generation, which was later a defining influence on the 1960s counterculture.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: Much of Burroughs' work is semiautobiographical, primarily drawn from his experiences as a heroin addict, as he lived throughout Mexico City, London, Paris and the Tangier International Zone near Morocco, as well as from his travels in the South American Amazon.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: His work also features frequent mystical, occult or otherwise magical themes – a constant preoccupation for Burroughs, both in fiction and in real life.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: Burroughs killed his second wife, Joan Vollmer, in 1951 in Mexico City.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: Burroughs initially claimed that he shot Vollmer while drunkenly attempting a "William Tell" stunt.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: He later told investigators a different story: that he had been showing his pistol to friends, when it fell and hit the table, firing the bullet that killed Vollmer.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: After Burroughs returned to the United States, he was convicted of manslaughter "in absentia", and received a two-year suspended sentence.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: Burroughs found success with his confessional first novel, "Junkie" (1953), but he is perhaps best known for his third novel "Naked Lunch" (1959), a highly controversial work that was the subject of a court case after it was challenged as being in violation of the U.S. sodomy laws.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: With Brion Gysin, he also popularized the literary cut-up technique in works such as The Nova Trilogy (1961–1964).

title: William S. Burroughs
text: In 1983, Burroughs was elected to the American Academy and Institute of Arts and Letters, and in 1984 he was awarded the Ordre des Arts et des Lettres by France.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: Jack Kerouac called Burroughs the "greatest satirical writer since Jonathan Swift", a reputation he owes to his "lifelong subversion" of the moral, political, and economic systems of modern American society, articulated in often darkly humorous sardonicism.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: J. G. Ballard considered Burroughs to be "the most important writer to emerge since the Second World War", while Norman Mailer declared him "the only American writer who may be conceivably possessed by genius".

title: William S. Burroughs
text: Burroughs created visual art throughout his lifetime, but never exhibited it until 1987, after the death of his friend and collaborator Brion Gysin.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: For the next and last 10 years of his life, he presented his paintings and drawings at museums and galleries worldwide.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: Burroughs had one child, William S. Burroughs Jr. (1947–1981), with his second wife Joan Vollmer.

title: William S. Burroughs
text: William Burroughs died at his home in Lawrence, Kansas, after suffering a heart attack in 1997.

title: I Want Your Love (film)
text: Love is the title of both a 2010 short film and a 2012 feature- length film.

title: I Want Your Love (film)
text: Both films were directed and written by Travis Mathews.

title: I Want Your Love (film)
text: The drama films both revolve around the friends and ex-lovers of Jesse Metzger, a gay man in his mid-thirties who is forced to move back to his hometown from San Francisco due to financial reasons.

title: I Want Your Love (film)
text: The actors' own names, along with much of their real- life stories, were used for their characters in both films, which features graphic sexual scenes.

title: I Want Your Love (film)
text: The production of both films was aided by the gay pornographic studio NakedSword.

title: I Want Your Love (film)
text: This led to the full- length film being refused exemption from classification, which would have allowed it to screen at the Melbourne Queer Film Festival, a decision to which actor James Franco( who invited Mathews to collaborate on Franco's film" Interior. Leather Bar.") reacted negatively.

title: The Fall of a Nation

title: Natalie Portman
text: Natalie Portman (born Neta-Lee Hershlag; June 9, 1981) is an actress and filmmaker with dual Israeli and American citizenship.

title: Natalie Portman
text: Prolific in film since a teenager, she has starred in blockbusters and also played psychologically troubled women in independent films, for which she has received several accolades, including an Academy Award and two Golden Globe Awards.

title: Natalie Portman
text: Portman began her acting career at age 12 by starring as the young protégée of a hitman in the action drama film (1994).

title: Natalie Portman
text: While in high school, she made her Broadway theatre debut in a 1998 production of "The Diary of a Young Girl" and gained international recognition for starring as Padmé Amidala in (1999).

title: Natalie Portman
text: From 1999 to 2003, Portman attended Harvard University for a bachelor's degree in psychology, while continuing to act in the "Star Wars" prequel trilogy (2002, 2005) and in The Public Theater's 2001 revival of Anton Chekhov's play "The Seagull".

title: Natalie Portman
text: In 2004, Portman was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress and won a Golden Globe Award for playing a mysterious stripper in the romantic drama "Closer".

title: Natalie Portman
text: Portman's career progressed with her starring roles as Evey Hammond in "V for Vendetta" (2006), Anne Boleyn in "The Other Boleyn Girl" (2008), and a troubled ballerina in the psychological horror film "Black Swan" (2010), for which she won the Academy Award for Best Actress.

title: Natalie Portman
text: She went on to star in the romantic comedy "

title: Natalie Portman
text: No Strings Attached" (2011) and featured as Jane Foster in the Marvel Cinematic Universe superhero films

title: Natalie Portman
text: "Thor" (2011), and (2013), which established her among the best-paid actresses in the world.

title: Natalie Portman
text: She has since portrayed Jacqueline Kennedy in the biopic "Jackie" (2016), gaining her third Academy Award nomination, and a biologist in the science fiction film "Annihilation" (2018).

title: Natalie Portman
text: Portman's directorial ventures include the short film "Eve" (2008) and the biographical drama "A Tale of Love and Darkness" (2015).

title: Natalie Portman
text: She is vocal about the politics of America and Israel, and is an advocate for animal rights and environmental causes.

title: Natalie Portman
text: She is married to dancer and choreographer Benjamin Millepied, with whom she has two children.

title: Mary Helen Bowers
text: Mary Helen Bowers( born 1979) is an American celebrity fitness guru, entrepreneur and former New York City Ballet dancer originally from Charlotte, North Carolina.

title: Mary Helen Bowers

title: Mary Helen Bowers
text: She was a full scholarship student at the School of American Ballet in Manhattan at fifteen years old.

title: Mary Helen Bowers

title: Mary Helen Bowers
text: She graduated with a Bachelor of Arts degree in English Literature from Columbia University in New York City.

title: Mary Helen Bowers

title: Mary Helen Bowers

title: Mary Helen Bowers

title: Sobhuza I
text: Sobhuza I (also known as Ngwane IV, Somhlolo) (ca. 1780–1836) was king of Swaziland, from 1815 to 1836.

title: Sobhuza I
text: Born around 1780, his father was Ndvungunye (also known as "Zikodze"), and his mother was Somnjalose Simelane.

title: Sobhuza I
text: He was called Somhlolo, "the Wonder," upon his birth because his father Ndvungunye died as a result of being struck by lightning.

title: Sobhuza I
text: When Sobhuza was king, Lojiba Simelane instead of his mother Somnjalose was Queen Mother because Somnjalose was an "inhlanti" or support bride to Lojiba.

title: Sobhuza I
text: Somhlolo is a greatly revered king of Swaziland.

title: Sobhuza I
text: He had his first royal capital or kraal at Zombodze in the Shiselweni region, but moved it north to new Zombodze in central Swaziland.

title: Sobhuza I
text: Swazis celebrate Somhlolo Day every September 6 as their Independence Day and the national stadium is named Somhlolo stadium.

title: Sobhuza I
text: Sobhuza was succeeded by his son Mswati II and his wife Tsandzile Ndwandwe as Queen Mother after a short regency by Queen Lojiba Simelane.

title: Sobhuza I
text: Sobhuza by the time of his death a conquered a country claimed to be reaching modern day Barberton in the north, Carolina in the west, Pongola River in the south and Lubombo Mountains in the east.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: Hans Barthold Andresen Butenschøn( 27 December 1877 – 28 November 1971) was a Norwegian businessperson.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He was born in Kristiania as a son of Nils August Andresen Butenschøn and Hanna Butenschøn, and grandson of Nicolay Andresen.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: Together with Mabel Anette Plahte( 1877 – 1973, a daughter of Frithjof M. Plahte) he had the son Hans Barthold Andresen Butenschøn Jr. and was through him the father- in- law of Ragnhild Butenschøn and grandfather of Peter Butenschøn.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: Through his daughter Marie Claudine he was the father- in- law of Joakim Lehmkuhl, through his daughter Mabel Anette he was the father- in- law of Harald Astrup( a son of Sigurd Astrup) and through his daughter Nini Augusta he was the father- in- law of Ernst Torp.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He took commerce school and agricultural school.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He was hired in the family company N. A. Andresen& Co, and became a co-owner in 1910.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He eventually became chief executive officer.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: The bank changed its name to Andresens Bank in 1913 and merged with Bergens Kreditbank in 1920.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: The merger was dissolved later in the 1920s.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He was also a landowner, owning Nedre Skøyen farm and a lot of land in Enebakk.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He chaired the board of Nydalens Compagnie from 1926, having not been a board member before that.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He also chaired the supervisory council of Forsikringsselskapet Viking and Nedre Glommen salgsforening, and was a supervisory council member of Filharmonisk Selskap.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He was a member of the gentlemen's club SK Fram since 1890, and was proclaimed a lifetime member in 1964.

title: Barthold A. Butenschøn Sr.
text: He was buried in Enebakk.

title: Waking Sleeping Beauty
text: Waking Sleeping Beauty is a 2009 American documentary film directed by Disney film producer Don Hahn and produced by Hahn and former Disney executive Peter Schneider.

title: Waking Sleeping Beauty
text: The film documents the history of Walt Disney Feature Animation from 1984 to 1994, covering the rise of a period referred to as the Disney Renaissance.

title: Waking Sleeping Beauty
text: The film uses no new on-camera interviews, instead relying primarily on archival interviews, press kit footage, in-progress and completed footage from the films being covered, and personal film/videos shot (often against company policy) by the employees of the animation studio.

title: Waking Sleeping Beauty
text: "Waking Sleeping Beauty" debuted at the 2009 Telluride Film Festival, and played at film festivals across the country before its limited theatrical release on March 26, 2010 by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures.

title: Fernando Di Leo
text: Fernando Di Leo( 11 January 1932 – 2 December 2003) was an Italian film director and script writer born in San Ferdinando di Puglia, Italy.

title: Fernando Di Leo
text: During his career from 1964 to 1985, Di Leo directed 20 films and was involved in the writing process in 43.

title: Fernando Di Leo
text: His films influenced many popular contemporary directors, such as Quentin Tarantino and John Woo.

title: Fernando Di Leo
text: Di Leo started his career mostly writing scripts for spaghetti westerns.

title: Fernando Di Leo
text: He worked on the script for" Per un pugno di dollariA Fistful of Dollars", 1964) and later as assistant director and assistant to Sergio Leone in" Per qualche dollaro in più For a Few Dollars More", 1965).

title: Fernando Di Leo
text: Later, he wrote scripts for such westerns as" Navajo Joe"( 1966) and" Johnny Yuma"( 1967).

title: Fernando Di Leo
text: Di Leo is now best remembered for his" poliziotteschi" films, especially the" Milieu Trilogy", which he both wrote and directed.

title: Fernando Di Leo
text: The trilogy contains" Caliber 9"( 1972)," La mala ordinaManhunt", 1972) and" Il Boss The Boss", 1973).

title: Björk
text: Björk Guðmundsdóttir (born 21 November 1965) is an Icelandic singer, songwriter, record producer, actress, and DJ.

title: Björk
text: Over her four-decade career, she has developed an eclectic musical style that draws on a range of influences and genres spanning electronic, pop, experimental, classical, trip hop, IDM, and avant-garde music.

title: Björk
text: Born and raised in Reykjavík, Björk began her music career at the age of 11 and first gained international recognition as the lead singer of the alternative rock band

title: Björk
text: The Sugarcubes, whose 1987 single "Birthday" was a hit on UK and US indie stations and a favourite among music critics.

title: Björk
text: After the band's breakup, Björk embarked on a solo career in 1993, coming to prominence as a solo artist with albums such as "Debut" (1993), "Post" (1995), and "Homogenic" (1997), while collaborating with a range of artists and exploring a variety of multimedia projects.

title: Björk
text: Several of Björk's albums have reached the top 20 on the US "Billboard" 200 chart, the most recent being "Vulnicura" (2015).

title: Björk
text: Björk’s fourth studio album, "Vespertine", was released in August 2001.

title: Björk
text: She has had 31 singles reach the top 40 on pop charts around the world, with 22 top 40 hits in the UK, including the top 10 hits

title: Björk
text: "It's Oh

title: Björk
text: So QuietArmy of Me", and "Hyperballad".

title: Björk
text: In 2004, Björk released her fifth studio album, "Medúlla", followed by her sixth studio album, "Volta", in May 2007.

title: Björk
text: Björk is reported to have sold between 20 and 40 million records worldwide .

title: Björk
text: She has won the 2010 Polar Music Prize from the Royal Swedish Academy of Music in recognition of her "deeply personal music and lyrics, her precise arrangements, and her unique voice.

title: Björk
text: Björk was included in "Time"'s 2015 list of the 100 most influential people in the world.

title: Björk
text: She was ranked both sixtieth and eighty-first in "Rolling Stone"

title: Björk
text: 's 100 greatest singers and songwriters lists respectively.

title: Björk
text: She has also won five BRIT Awards and has been nominated for 15 Grammy Awards.

title: Björk
text: Björk's ninth studio album, "Utopia", was released in November 2017 through One Little Indian Records.

title: Björk
text: Outside her music career, Björk starred in the 2000 Lars von Trier film "Dancer in the Dark", for which she won the Best Actress Award at the 2000 Cannes Film Festival, and was nominated for Academy Award for Best Original Song for

title: Björk
text: "I've Seen It All".

title: Björk
text: Her 2011 album "Biophilia" was marketed as an interactive app album with its own education program.

title: Björk
text: Björk has also been an advocate for environmental causes in her home country Iceland.

title: Björk
text: A full-scale retrospective exhibition dedicated to Björk was held at the New York Museum of Modern Art in 2015.

title: Billy Milano
text: Billy Milano is a Bronx- born heavy metal musician now based in Austin, Texas.

title: Billy Milano
text: He is the singer and- occasionally- guitarist and bassist of crossover thrash band M.O.D., and he was also the singer of its predecessor, Stormtroopers of Death.

title: Billy Milano
text: He was also the singer of United Forces, which also featured his Stormtroopers of Death bandmate Dan Lilker.

title: Hunter (Björk song)
text: "Hunter" is a song recorded by Icelandic musician Björk for her third studio album "Homogenic" (1997).

title: Hunter (Björk song)
text: The lyrics explore the pressure Björk felt to write music after realising the workforce that depended on her, following the success she found as a solo artist with her previous studio albums.

title: Hunter (Björk song)
text: The song was first performed at the 1997 Tibetan Freedom Concert and later included with the online promotional release of "Homogenic"; the track was subsequently released as the third single for the album as three different CD releases in October 1998.

title: Hunter (Björk song)
text: A collaborative effort between Björk and Mark Bell, "Hunter" features a dark combination of strings and layered synths, a militaristic electronic beat, and enigmatic lyrics about the heading towards a mission.

title: Hunter (Björk song)
text: Most music critics were enticed by "Hunter", which they declared one of the highlights of the "Homogenic" album.

title: Hunter (Björk song)
text: The single charted poorly, peaking at number 44 on the UK Singles Chart and number 55 on the French Singles Chart.

title: Hunter (Björk song)
text: The song was included in the compilation album "Greatest Hits" (2002), whose tracks were selected by fans through a survey.

title: Hunter (Björk song)
text: The accompanying music video for "Hunter" was directed by longtime collaborator Paul White of Me Company and consists of a close-up of a bald Björk as she transforms into a "techno-bear" while singing.

title: Hunter (Björk song)
text: Seeking to convey the music's fusion of organic and technological, the polar bear was animated in a non-naturalistic fashion; the bear also embodies the ferocious hunter the lyrics represent.

title: Hunter (Björk song)
text: The song's video garnered acclaim from critics.

title: Hunter (Björk song)
text: Björk has performed "Hunter" on " Later... with Jools Holland" and in five of her tours, the most recent being the Vulnicura Tour.

title: Taylor Hunter

text: He was the son of Charles Somerset, 1st Earl of Worcester and Elizabeth Herbert, 3rd Baroness Herbert.

title: Henry Somerset, 2nd Earl of Worcester
text: On his father's death on 15 April 1526, he succeeded as the second Earl of Worcester.

text: From his mother, he inherited the title of Baron Herbert.
